21 2021-01-29 dizziness Pt was administered the first dose of Moderna Covid-19 vaccine at 1930 hours and then monitored for ... Read more
Close
Pt was administered the first dose of Moderna Covid-19 vaccine at 1930 hours and then monitored for 15 minutes post admin. During that time, pt developed some face and neck skin flushing, dizziness and "heart racing." Pt notes she has allergies to shellfish and tree nuts. Pt does not appear to have any respiratory compromise, denies any pain or trouble breathing, denies CP, HA, N/V/D, SOB, LOC. Pt airway is patent and pt does not appear to be in anaphylaxis. Pt denies any PMH; pt hx IUD placement and pt states she takes vitamins. Four-lead and 12-lead ECG monitoring showing sinus tachycardia, with a max sustained rate in the 170s at one point. Pt is otherwise asymptomatic. Transported to ED as a precaution. Pt HR gradually decreased en route to the 130s. Vagal maneuvers attempted twice, briefly dropping pt HR into the 70s and sinus rhythm, but effect was unsustained. Transport otherwise unremarkable

Close

Went to urgent care because hives were all over. Rec'd Medrol from urgent care along with hydroxyzine. Got relief on 1/9/21.
21 2021-01-31 dizziness Dizzy spells and weakness
21 2021-01-31 movement disorder, vertigo, dizziness Immediate burning in arm right after receiving shot. 15 minutes after receiving shot began to feel t... Read more
Close
Immediate burning in arm right after receiving shot. 15 minutes after receiving shot began to feel tired and got a headache. Later on in the evening I had discomfort in my chest and had to use my inhaler. Pain in arm worsened over night; couldn't move arm at all. Pains spread into armpit and back. Got up at 3am to my body shivering, thinking I was running a fever I checked my temperature and it was normal but upon standing I had extreme dizziness to the point of almost passing's out, I had to sit down right away. Had nausea and whole body felt very sore an achey. The morning after my shot I woke with a headache, extreme pain in my arm and armpit, soreness all over my body, stomach pains, and my heart rate was high. Throughout the day my symptoms got worse I ran a fever of 102.7 which broke but then came back later on in the evening. The following day my symptoms started to diminish, no fever and body was feeling better, arm pain and headache continued. Now I am on day 4 still experiencing pain in my arm and armpit, slight headache, but chest pains have started. It feels as if there is a brick on my chest, almost like a burning sensation with occasional pains in left breast as well as tightness in the left side of my neck.
21 2021-02-02 fall After receiving the vaccine, she started to faint, slumping over her chair and fell to the floor. He... Read more
Close
After receiving the vaccine, she started to faint, slumping over her chair and fell to the floor. Her eyes were blinking quickly. She was breathing rapidly. She whispered that she was scared. I told her to take deep breaths to try and calm her. I asked if she felt hurt or if she has any trouble breathing. After about 3-5 minutes of lying on their ground, she became more alert and asked me if she fell from her chair. She didn't recall falling or that she said she was scared. I had her sit up and asked how she felt and if she had any symptoms of an allergic reaction--she said no. after another minute or 2, she was able to stand up on her own with no lightheadedness nor dizziness. I walked alongside her to another seat and she sat for another 25 to 30 minutes--she said she was completely fine before leaving with her sister

21 2021-02-04 dizziness After receiving vaccine, Employee complained of tachycardia (P=100), some dizziness. Employee dran... Read more
Close
After receiving vaccine, Employee complained of tachycardia (P=100), some dizziness. Employee drank water and juice. Employee appeared like she might vomit and started shaking, employee was lifted from her chair to the floor. Employee was turned to her right side and was having a seizure. CODE Team was called and Employee was taken to Emergency room via stretcher.
21 2021-02-04 joint range of motion decreased About 3-4 hours after the injection was given, my left arm began to hurt at the sight of the injecti... Read more
Close
About 3-4 hours after the injection was given, my left arm began to hurt at the sight of the injection. It was sore red and beginning to swell. After a couple more hours it was difficult to even move my arm; it felt as if my tricep was almost entirely immobilized. These symptoms persisted for about three days, with increasingly less intensity, and after the fourth day, I had no adverse symptoms. Exactly six days after receiving the vaccine, the area where the injection was given (tricep) began to feel itchy. When I tried to scratch it, the itch was not relieved but only worsened and began to swell and turn red. By the following day (7 days after injection), the site of injection and area surrounding the site of injection (about 6 inches along my upper and 3-4 inches in width) had swelled up more and was significantly more inflamed than my opposite arm which hadn't changed at all. It had a similar swelling, itch, and pain to the sensation one experiences after getting bitten by a mosquito, but in this case a very very large mosquito bite. By the evening of the seventh day, I began feeling very fatigued both mentally and physically and felt very subtle body aches that usually signal the early signs of a fever (at least for me). Upon feeling feverish symptoms I made a drink of turmeric and ginger root powder with honey and laid down for about an hour in an attempt to rest. After an hour, the body aches and fatigue lessened in intensity but my arm was still swelling and now feeling hot in temperature. The itching was unbearable. I went to go take a warm shower later that night and started to feel a mixture of pressure and pain traveling up my arm and into my chest. I began feeling my lymph nodes on the left side of my breast to find that a lymph node in my armpit and another one on the side of my breast had enlarged to about two inches in diameter. They were painful to the touch and noticeably sore when left untouched. These symptoms persisted with no change for about 2 days. After two days, the swelling and itching in my arm went away but my lymph nodes were still inflamed. They did not reduce in size or in pain until about 7 days after the first signs of these symptoms. After a week all symptoms went away.

21 2021-02-08 dizziness The symptoms began immediately after administration of the vaccine. The symptoms were: tingling of ... Read more
Close
The symptoms began immediately after administration of the vaccine. The symptoms were: tingling of her back / spine and then two hours later had itching swelling of the throat like she couldn't swallow felt lightheaded and dizzy and took benadryl with improvement. On day 2 felt feverish with sore arm and then on the 3rd day developed the same symptoms as the first day and went to the ED after taking benadryl x2 with no improvement in her symptoms. Objectively there is no wheezing, swelling, or rash but the provider does note that there were 3 small excoriated spots on her wrist one of which looked like a hive. The treatment of the reaction was: o Antihistamines: benadryl 50mg at home and ibuprofen o Steroids: IV solumedrol o Epinephrine: x1 o ED admission

21 2021-03-15 dizziness Patient received first dose of Moderna COVID-19 vaccine on 2/10/21 and had a large, red, inflamed ar... Read more
Close
Patient received first dose of Moderna COVID-19 vaccine on 2/10/21 and had a large, red, inflamed area on her arm at the injection site for a few days, but otherwise tolerated vaccine well. She received the second dose of the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine on 3/10/21 and the next day (3/11/21) developed fatigue and lightheadedness while exercising, which continued for the next few days. She developed acute onset, sharp chest pain on 3/13/21 AM which did not resolve so she presented to an ED. Vitals were normal but labs notable for troponin I which peaked at 4.36, CK 758, d-dimer 640. CBC/CMP and EKG were unremarkable and initial TTE with EF ~45%. Repeat TTE obtained a few days later with normal LV and RV size/function without any wall motion abnormalities. Cardiac MRI obtained with normal LV function (EF 64%) but late gadolinium enhancement in a subepicardial distribution within the inferolateral wall of the left ventricle at the base most compatible with myocarditis. ESR and CRP were normal. Further workup to determine etiology of myocarditis was negative (ANA, ANCA, RF, hepatitis panel, HIV, full respiratory viral panel, COVID-19 PCR). She was placed on metoprolol succinate 12.5mg XL daily and will follow up with a cardiologist as an outpatient. Family concerned that COVID-19 vaccine was the trigger/underlying etiology of her myocarditis.

21 2021-03-23 fall It was weird again; Turning into a bruise; Felt crappy; A couple of bad breakthrough bleeding episod... Read more
Close
It was weird again; Turning into a bruise; Felt crappy; A couple of bad breakthrough bleeding episodes; Menstrual cycle was interrupted; Felt off; In her right leg raised hive; Headache; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer concerning a 21-year-old female patient, who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced a couple of bad breakthrough bleeding episodes, Menstrual cycle was interrupted, Felt crappy, Felt off, In her right leg raised hive, Headache, Turning into a bruise and It was weird again. The patient's medical history was reported as migraines. Concomitant medications were not reported. On 27 Feb 2021, prior to the onset of the event, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot number: 013A21A) intramuscularly in the right thigh for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 27 FEB 2021, the patient experienced Raised hive (Urticaria) about the size of a half dollar, after that she "felt off" (fall) had a headache (Headache) and Felt crappy (Malaise), and she had a couple of bad breakthrough bleeding episodes (Hemorrhage) which was assessed as medically significant, and the patient also experienced interrupted Menstrual cycle (Menstrual disorder). On 07 MAR 2021, the patient experienced Turning into a bruise (Contusion) and on 08 MAR 2021 it was weird again (Feeling abnormal). Laboratory details were not provided. Treatment medication was provided as Tylenol. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not reported. At the time of this report, the outcome of the events Hemorrhage, Menstrual disorder, Contusion, Malaise, Feeling abnormal, Fall, Urticaria and Headache was considered as unknown.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
21 2021-03-24 dizziness Approximately 12 hours after the event, I had throat swelling, chills, sweats, temperature of 102.5,... Read more
Close
Approximately 12 hours after the event, I had throat swelling, chills, sweats, temperature of 102.5, headache, muscle soreness, dizziness, lightheadedness. Onset was over the course of about 1 hour. I had previously taken part in the double-blinded Astrazeneca in COVID-19 trials (meaning I did not know I was vaccinated) in November 2019, so the nurse told me that the response could really be from anything: partly due to some interaction between the vaccines, allergy, and/or already producing antibodies. I was unblinded and told I was given the Astrazeneca vaccine. Interestingly, I had none of these responses to just the Astrazeneca vaccines, just a bit of soreness after the first one. I have never had such a strong response, and I believe this is the highest my temperature has ever been, and my lymph nodes are still swollen. I am much better now; however, even last night and this morning, I was feeling unwell.

Patient reported lightheadedness and feeling nauseas and faint about 2 minutes after vaccination. Placed supine for about 5 minutes with good effect. Water provided. Reported she did not eat breakfast this morning. Patient was in recovery for 30 minutes. Patient reported feeling well. Advised patient to complete VAERS side effect report. Picked up by boyfriend at 10:40. Advised patient to eat before next vaccine visit. Advised patient to lay down at next vaccine appointment. Patient stable at discharge.
22 2021-01-07 dizziness Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA At about 10:00pm Wednesday, I started to have a headache and feel tired... Read more
Close
Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA At about 10:00pm Wednesday, I started to have a headache and feel tired. My temperature was mostly normal (99.4F) when I went to bed around 2:00am. When I woke up at 12:00pm Thursday, my temperature was 103.9F. By 12:30pm, it was 102.9F. I had a very bad headache, sore throat, nausea, and some light-headedness. My fever went down throughout the day with 2 doses of Tylenol at 1:00pm and 6:30pm. The sore throat, nausea, and light-headedness resolved during the evening, but my headache was constant until I went to bed. Today (Friday), I woke up with a slight headache but no fever or other symptoms.

Close
After vaccination, she reported to the ER. She stayed in observation for about 4 hours. States about 20 minutes afterward developed some sensation of tightness in her throat, upper chest pain, and some dizziness. Patient has a history of allergic reactions and in the past has had anaphylaxis she does carry a EpiPen. Patient took Benadryl prior to vaccine this morning and then again afterwards a total of 50 mg, did not notice any swelling of her face tongue or lip, there is no wheezing or difficulty breathing not noticed any rash or hives. Received Famotidine, methylprednisolone and IV fluids when in the ER. The next morning she was found be Covid Positive and they did not know it previous.

01/06/2021 5:30PM- I became dizzy lightheaded and clamy. I had severe joint and muscle pain. I had the chills and could not stop shaking. I was very weak and could not even move out of bed, Leading to me calling 911 for an ambulance at 10:21pm. They kept me in the Emergency department until 5:30am because they could not get my heart rate to stay down. Stony Brook nurse told me it was okay to get vaccine even though I was infected with COVID-19 ON 12/15/2020.

On the way, the patient began to black out to the point where she had to lay down on the floor and could not regain strength for a few minutes and would have fallen over if sitting down and then laying down did not occur. A few minutes were spent laying down and then the episode went away and she was able to get up. She then walked back to her bed and did began to feel light headed, dizzy, and began blacking out again. The patient layed down in bed and waited for the episode to pass again.

22 2021-01-14 dizziness Fainting; Dizziness; Body ache; Joint pain; A spontaneous report was received from a 22-year-old fem... Read more
Close
Fainting; Dizziness; Body ache; Joint pain; A spontaneous report was received from a 22-year-old female consumer, who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine and experienced dizziness, fainting, joint pain, and body aches. The patient's medical history was not provided. No relevant concomitant medications were reported. On 31 Dec 2020 at 13:30, prior to the onset of the events, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 intramuscularly in the left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 31 Dec 2020, after vaccine administration, the patient experienced dizziness, fainting, joint pain, and body aches. No treatment information was provided. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the event was not reported. The outcome for the events, dizziness, fainting, joint pain, and body aches, was not reported.; Reporter's Comments: This case concerns a 22 year-old, female patient, who experienced events of dizziness, fainting, joint pain, and body aches. The events occurred on the same day after the first dose of mRNA-1273 vaccine administration. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded and the events are assessed as possibly related.

This continued but then completely stopped 2 hours later, weirdly it returned exactly 24 hours later only not as extreme. I feel fine now but I also felt the need to call 911 during this episode.
22 2021-01-18 dizziness 1/14/21- 10:30am Noticed some fullness/swelling in throat. Was still able to breath fine, but defini... Read more
Close
1/14/21- 10:30am Noticed some fullness/swelling in throat. Was still able to breath fine, but definitely noticed a difference. This lasted a few hours. 1/15/21- 3:45am I got up to use bathroom and noticed I was very lightheaded. I thought maybe I just stood up too fast. I got back in bed and my arm was 8/10 pain so I also thought faintness could possibly due to pain. 7:15am I got up to go to work and quickly felt very warm and my vision started to go black. I laid back down for a few minutes until this resolved. I took my temperature and it was 99.0. I got up again and started to get ready but began feeling light headed again. I ended up getting ready while sitting down because I kept feeling too much like I was going to pass out. I ate breakfast and felt fine. 8:00am I left for work and after driving for about 5 minutes I felt myself getting very warm again and light-headed. I ended up pulling over and calling for someone to come pick me up. 9:00am My temperature was 99.5. My blood pressure laying down was 110/74 and HR was 74. After standing for 5 minutes my BP was 90/70 and my HR was 92. During this 5 minutes of standing I felt myself getting warm again but my vision did not start to go black and I was able to stand for the full 5 minutes. At various times throughout the day I would feel faint if I was standing or sitting upright for too long. The last time I felt this was was probably 11:30pm on 1/15/21. 1/16/21 - No light-headedness or warmth. Did feel some slight chest pressure, but nothing crazy and it only lasted maybe half of the day.

Pt received dose #1 Moderna COVID vaccine 1/22/21 @ Vaccine clinic. 1/24/21 scheduled virtual urgent care visit reporting generalized fatigue and malaise/myalgias as well as some nausea and headache. Intermittent for months, was feeling better, then recurred after COVID vaccine. Provider indicates this may be related to the vaccine. Plan to treat with OTC Tylenol or Motrin and increase her fluid intake over the next day or 2. Presented to ED later the same day for workup. "Pt reports weak, low energy, nausea, headache, dizzy at time, chills, malaise, weakness, feelings of hypoglycemic." Workup negative, discharged home without treatment or escalation of care. Entered by PSS for tracking.

Close
Right after the injection, I had minor arm soreness which increased as the day went on. Approximately 12 hours after the injection I started feeling very tired and achy. My arm hurt very badly and I started getting chills. About an hour later I had a 101.1 degree fever. I also experienced very slight shortness of breath which went away when I used my albuterol inhaler. My shoulder where I got the injection hurt so badly that I could like raise it, lie on it or touch it really. The fever continued into the night but was gone by around 9am. I continued to feel tired and achy all day the next day, with occasional shooting headache pains. I did feel better and better as the day went on though. Question: I take a daily supplement of 6g of marine collagen. I happened to take the marine collagen 1 hour before the onset of chills and fever - could there be a correlation between the collagen and the worsening symptoms? I have never had any type of reaction to the collagen before and have been taking it for about 3 weeks.

Close
Right after getting the shot, I felt dizzy, had a sore arm, and my heart was beating too fast, for about an hour. At 9:30 the next morning, I developed a fever of 100.5 and body aches. Around 2 pm, I got a headache which felt like it was because blood was hitting the veins in my head really hard- I think that's high blood pressure? My blood pressure was 126/85. I read not to take medicine because it would make the vaccine less effective, but I had to take an aspirin at 8 pm because I couldn't handle the headache any more, and ever since, I've just had a sore arm and a headache when I walk too fast (it's been two days after the shot now).

Close
Immediate dizziness @ 10:00 AM, thought it was related to anxiety. Left after sitting for 20 minutes because I thought the "anxiety" would resolve best at home. Arrived home at 10:25 AM. My lips started itching, and then swelled along with my tongue. My throat felt tight and I tried to take an oral Benadryl. It got stuck in my throat and I was unable to swallow the pill. It was also difficult to swallow water. I arrived at the ED by 10:40 AM, where I was treated with IV Benadryl and Solu-Medrol. I remained swollen all over, especially in my fingers, for the next 4 days. I gained 12 pounds, either from the reaction or the steroids. My airway did not fully close.

22 2021-01-31 dizziness Patient reported: fast heartbeat, bad rash all over body, dizziness / weakness, shaking, full body ... Read more
Close
Patient reported: fast heartbeat, bad rash all over body, dizziness / weakness, shaking, full body tremor, severe itching - within 4 hours of receiving vaccination - went to Emergency Department. This is a pleasant 22-year-old female with past medical history of anxiety and depression who presents for possible allergic reaction. Patient states that at 12:08 p.m. just prior to arrival she received the 2nd COVID-19 vaccine. She states that immediately following the administration of this she became hot, flushed and sweaty. She then began having itching and hives. She denies any difficulty breathing. She denies any swelling of the lips or tongue. No difficulty swallowing. No shortness of breath or chest pain. No recent illness. No nausea or vomiting. Patient is a nonsmoker and denies alcohol or drug use. She denies pregnancy with a history of IUD.Clinical presentation concerning for allergic reaction. This is a 22-year-old female who developed itching, rash and throat tightness following her 2nd COVID-19 vaccine. Patient is hemodynamically stable. She is anxious in appearance. No obvious edema of the lips or tongue. No respiratory distress. No stridor. She is 98% on room air. In IVs immediately established. She is given 125 mg of Solu-Medrol, 20 Pepcid and 50 of Benadryl. Following all of her medications, she no longer has any of her symptoms. Her rash and hives has completely resolved. I discussed this with Dr. who was in agreement that she is stable for discharge. She will be sent home on additional 3 day course of prednisone to be started tomorrow, clear 10 for 10 days and Pepcid for 10 days. Questions addressed and answered prior to discharge. Patient discharged home in stable condition.

I felt back to myself by around 4:00 p.m. January 29th, 2021."

Patient collapsed to the ground when walking to leave the post vaccine clinic observation area. She collapsed and had a 60second seizure followed by 4 minutes of post ictal activity. She did not vocalize answers during the time but nodded yes when asked if she had a seizure disorder. Patient had another 60 second seizure and then EMS arrived. Her seizure was generalized twitching and patient was unconscious. Vitals remained stable.

Close
Adverse events: 0600-1030 - Pain in arm got increasingly worse. 1015 - Felt super cold and nauseous. 1020 - Got a hot flash, felt dizzy and lightheaded, and heard ringing in my left ear. 1025 - I had trouble breathing and my throat felt tight. I developed hives on my forehead, cheeks, neck, chest, and arms. The fingers on both my hands and my lips were tingling. Treatment: I was rushed to the ER and given an IV steroid, IV fluids (2 bags), and IV benadryl. Outcome: All the reactions went away within 4 hours and I was discharged from the ER. I was advised to take benadryl for 48 hours afterwards as needed and given a 5 day course of prednisone; 2 tablets taken daily.

Patient did not hit head. Patient alert and oriented x3, and remained so for the duration. 22 2021-02-12 dizziness First night (Saturday, 2/6) - around 7-8pm, became fatigued, lethargic, headache, muscle pain, cough... Read more
Close
First night (Saturday, 2/6) - around 7-8pm, became fatigued, lethargic, headache, muscle pain, cough, fever (as expected for second dose); Sunday (2/7) - same symptoms, less severe; Monday (2/8) - no symptoms; Tuesday (2/9) - hard to get up in morning (extreme fatigue), chills, muscle aches, productive cough, headache, dry mouth, ocular sinus pressure, cyanosis (not severe - blue fingernails, blue toenails, feet slightly blue), dizziness, trouble breathing when walking up stairs. Symptoms would come and go throughout day, but were worse in the mornings. Wednesday (2/10) - Present (2/13) - same symptoms as Tuesday (2/9). Symptoms worse in the mornings and after physical exertion (going to school, walking stairs), and at night as well. Symptoms are not severe, but I am concerned that they have lasted a full week. I have been taking Day-Quil severe every 4 hours. I was also on my period, which just ended yesterday (2/12). I believe my period started the day of the vaccine. I plan on going to a doctor's office, but have been too tired to move from my apartment.

Sharp CP radiating to diaphragm and throat swelling since last night. +wheezing. Walking from bed to bathroom gets SOB SOB gradually worsened as time passed Dizziness since difficulty breathing paresthesia in hands diaphoresis - pt attributes to fever/chills she has been getting since having the vaccine Denies n/v, abdominal pain, syncope Dyspnea, oral swelling, CP began s/p Moderna vaccine 2 of 2 and gradually worsening Advised ER via ambulance. Pt prefers to wait for her dad to take her to the ER Counseled pt on risk of death due to airway cut off due to worsening sx: bronchial inflammation/throat swelling or decreased oxygen to heart/brain with dizziness (MI/stroke). Advised tools EMS would be able to administer life saving medications to support her in these emergent situations and quickly get pt to ER vs having her die in car with dad bearing guilt of losing daughter. Pt expresses understanding, will wait for her dad. Suggested pt have a code word to say so if things getting worse her dad pulls over to call 911. Pt agreeable.

22 2021-03-04 dizziness Patient began feeling dizzy, nauseous, flushed, shaky, and vomited several times after receiving her... Read more
Close
Patient began feeling dizzy, nauseous, flushed, shaky, and vomited several times after receiving her second dose of the covid vaccine. Her blood pressure was 127/107 and pule was 120 50 minutes after the vaccination was administered. The patient was given a cold wash cloth on the back of her neck and on her wrists and water to sip on. EMS was called and they administered Zofran and took the patient to the hospital to be evaluated. The patient was very anxious before receiving her vaccine and said she has anxiety and did not take her anxiety medication today.

22 2021-03-04 dizziness The vaccine was administered to the patient in the consultation room. Once we left the consultation ... Read more
Close
The vaccine was administered to the patient in the consultation room. Once we left the consultation room, after about 2 minutes, the patient got my attention and complained of feeling dizzy. I went to her side, and she told me that she felt like she was going to pass out. The patient then proceeded to lose consciousness while sitting in a chair in the waiting area. She then exhibited seizure-like movements (muscles contracted, groaning sounds) for about 10 seconds, and she then regained consciousness. I administered no treatment, since this did not exhibit the signs of an anaphylactic reaction. 911 was called, and emergency medical services arrived. The patient was then taken to the hospital. The patient stated that she has had a similar reaction in the past to getting a vaccine, she thinks it is from the stress of getting injected with a needle.

Fell and hit my head and got a concussion.

According to eye witness statement she started to tilt forward and fell on the floor landing on her right shoulder. She did not witness her head connect to the floor. after 3 seconds she regained conscious and started shaking and vomiting. Medical attention was provided immediately, patient was stabilized and blood pressure checked. after vomiting pt state she immediately felt better. she was provided water and monitored for additional 30 min. she refused EMS or any additional medical treatment. Then event was also documented by store management.

22 2021-03-16 dizziness received her COVID Moderna 1st dose vaccine on 3/15/21 in the late afternoon. After she had her vacc... Read more
Close
received her COVID Moderna 1st dose vaccine on 3/15/21 in the late afternoon. After she had her vaccine she sat down in a chair and waited out her 15 minutes. During this time she said her ears were ringing and she felt faint. We switched her chair to one with larger arms to sit. She asked for water, we provided her a bottle of water and she started to breathe heavily. Her mom was with her and also was vaccinated waiting for 15 minutes. During this time her breathing became labored and she was feeling very faint. I called 911 and EMS arrived about 10 minutes later to see how she was doing. At no point did Taylor pass out or lose consciousness. She was cleared by EMS who checked her blood pressure which was normal and she did not have labored breathing after their visit. During the EMS check they asked the last time she ate and that was at 11 am. She declined medical transport to the hospital and was able to walk out of the facility.
22 2021-03-17 dizziness Patient had what appeared to be a vasovagal reaction. She complained of feeling light-headed and na... Read more
Close
Patient had what appeared to be a vasovagal reaction. She complained of feeling light-headed and nauseous about 5-10 minutes after receiving the vaccine. This continued for a short time and she also began to complain of feeling chilled and was noticeably diaphoretic. I monitored her blood pressure, which was low on the initial reading and then eventually came up to a reading of 89/60 with a pulse of 73 at the point that her symptoms began to subside. By approximately 45 minutes after the episode began, she reported feeling better and was able to stand and walk without symptoms. She went home at that time with a friend.

Close
I received the vaccine at 11:30am. About a half hour after receiving the vaccine, I felt dizziness and very slight chest tightness. I took benadryl, and was relieved of these symptoms. Then, around 9pm that night, I developed a fever. The highest temperature I recorded was 101.9. I took Ibuprofen around 11pm, and was afebrile by 3am. I have not had any fevers since, and I did have to call off work New Year's day. I have had an intermittent, mild headache since receiving the vaccine as well, but overall I feel fine.

23 2021-01-06 injected limb mobility decreased On day 1 (day I was vaccinated) I experienced severe pain in my arm where I was injected with the va... Read more
Close
On day 1 (day I was vaccinated) I experienced severe pain in my arm where I was injected with the vaccine 3 hours after receiving it. I couldn't use my arm for the rest of the day and had to take Tylenol to help with swelling and pain. Pain was dull and throbbing. The next morning I woke up to body chills, a low grade fever, muscle aches, vomiting, exhaustion/fatigue, coughing, and diarrhea. The injection site was still very tender, sore, and swollen with limited mobility. All symptoms subsided within two days other than fatigue and a sore arm. On day 3 I developed a cough that lasted 4-5 days. Other than a cough, I had no other symptoms after that. My arm was better with no pain and easy to use. Then on day 8 my arm started to swell again and I developed a distinct rash at the injection site. The skin around the area was hot to touch and very hard and tender. I took ibuprofen and rubbed out the arm to help. I contacted my provider and she examined the arm, concerned I was having a reaction and possibly developing cellulitis. On day 9 the rash spread to the whole upper arm and shoulder were hot to touch/feverish, painful, hard, and still swollen. The swelling has continued to move up my arm. I am seeking medical attention today on 1/7/21 for treatment of possible cellulitis.

Close
Approximately 2 hours after the vaccine, I developed severe pain to the injection site and arm. Inability to lift arm. I had severe night sweats that night, but no fever. Now it is day 3 post vaccine and I have a severe headache causing dizziness and nausea.

Close
1/10/21 - Feeling of "pulling a muscle" in armpit in left upper extremity that limited movement. (around 8:00 am). New onset of hives, erythema, warmth, edema, pain, and itching experienced at injection site in left upper extremity (6:34 pm). Call was placed to NP, the provider on call at 6:46 pm. Under advisement of provider, application of hydrocortisone cream at injection site and X2 PO 25 mg benadryl self-administered (around 7:00 pm). Sensation of throat closing and hoarseness/change in voice surfaced (around 7:45 pm). Presented to ED, with complaints as listed (around 8:15 pm). Condition/symptoms treated at ED with 60 mg prednisone and pepcid (8:31 pm) followed by direct observation until 10:08 pm. Prescription for prednisone 20 mg X3/day for 5 days written by MD. 1/11/21 - Arm continued to appear slightly swollen with erythema and warmth at the site. Treatment included observation throughout the day. 1/12/21 - Follow-up appointment attended with provider at 2:10 pm. Told by provider that prednisone would only be necessary in the case of resurfacing symptoms of a hypersensitivity reaction. At this time the cause of said symptoms is undetermined. Tingling sensation experienced in face and direct observation of left-sided facial swelling noticed (5:59 pm). Call placed to provider on call (6:08 pm) . Provider advised to take X2 25 mg benadryl and to take X3 20 mg prednisone stat. Benadryl taken at 6:15 pm and prednisone taken at 6:30 pm. Tingling sensation minimized by 7:30 pm, but left sided facial swelling remains as of 7:40 pm. Plans to follow-up with PCP later in the week and potential for re-visiting ED if symptoms worsen or continue throughout the night.

Close
Before injection patient was very nervous and did not eat breakfast. 3 minutes after injection patient complained of blurred vision and dizziness. BP 88/50, HR 54, O2 92%, pale in color, patient started to shake and have seizure activity only lasting a few seconds. 3 person assist to lie flat on the floor, rolled to left side. Patient was non-verbal at this time. 911 was called. At 9:11 AM EMS arrived and patient was responding at that time, patient transferred to the hospital. After hospital visit staff reported back the doctor felt it was an anxiety response rather than a vaccine reaction.

23 2021-01-14 mobility decreased Gradual onset of soreness beginning about an hour post-vaccine and worsening throughout day. By the ... Read more
Close
Gradual onset of soreness beginning about an hour post-vaccine and worsening throughout day. By the evening, left arm pain was too uncomfortable to wash dishes and lift household objects. Pain woke me up at 3am that night and I could not push the covers off of me, dress or undress, and I experienced severe pain with slight movement (7/10). Nausea and cold sweats began around 5am and lasted for 45min. I contacted the nurse via messaging system and was told to take OTC nausea medicine and Tylenol. I took the maximum dosage for Tylenol that day but could not do my normal school functions. The next day I was still limited by pain but did not require medication to cope. By day three, I had full range of motion back and minimal pain. Day four I am back to exercising normally.

23 2021-01-17 mobility decreased A few hours after receiving the vaccine I had muscle soreness onset in L deltoid near site of inject... Read more
Close
A few hours after receiving the vaccine I had muscle soreness onset in L deltoid near site of injection. A few hours after that I had moderate soreness in L deltoid, down L arm (bicep/tricep), and up into L pec and trap. I had difficulty abducting L arm to 90 deg but was not hindered in normal movements. Approaching midnight that day the soreness was improving and by mid next day it was limited to L deltoid upon palpation. After 2-3 days soreness resolved. No other adverse effects noted. I have had very minor muscle soreness to a few vaccinations before, but not this bad. In those cases it has been limited to site of injection (deltoid) and less severe. Usually I don't notice anything after injections and I've never had any other adverse effects.

I went to the Emergency Department and got Prednisone, Pepcid, and Benadryl. The next day, I started to experience tremors, mostly in my right hand. Two days later, I was so dizzy that the room was spinning and I could hardly stand up. Did not receive treatment for it.

23 2021-01-22 dizziness Patient only had muffin and coffee that day early in am. Had some arm pain after shot no other react... Read more
Close
Patient only had muffin and coffee that day early in am. Had some arm pain after shot no other reaction. Did go home felt some nausea . Did not throw up. Did not eat anything rest of day until around 11:30 pm . Felt much more nauseated and stomach cramping. Said she felt light headed and then had what appears to be vasovagal with brief passing out and then revived and with sweats. Was not confused . Did not loose continence. Was completely coherent after event. Went to ER to be checked out. In ER was found to have UTI and given some Rochephin . Had severe face and body swelling reaction requiring benadryl. Was observed and sent home after several hours. It was assumed that ER had reported this although it was felt by ER and us that this was vasovagal from not eating and nausea and UTI on top of that. Did not feel was secondary to vaccine . ER did not feel it was either. However while probably unrelated we felt should document it.
23 2021-01-23 gait disturbance Following the second phase around 5pm the intense feeling being extremely cold and despite being und... Read more
Close
Following the second phase around 5pm the intense feeling being extremely cold and despite being under 4 covers and a heated blanket I did not find relief. At this time the injection site was inflamed and painful to the slightest touch and beginning to experience a severe headache I took Nyquil Cold and Flu 30mL and ibuprofen 800. 5am I am waking up with a fever of 101.7, stiff hands, and a continuation of the headache and body aches from the night. I again took ibuprofen 800, and 2 Tylenols extra strength (as needed) every 4 hours, and Nyquil Cold and Flu 30mL in the morning and evening. My body temperature seemed to have fluctuated every hour being unbearably cold to blood boiling hot with every move I make painful to the point of being bed ridden and needing assistance to get up to go to the restroom. My injection site has grown from the size of a quarter on Friday Morning 1/22 to about the size of grapefruit by Sunday 1/24 . I have pictures documenting its growth.
23 2021-01-25 fall I stay at my parents the night before work because their home is located much closer to work--my fia... Read more
Close
I stay at my parents the night before work because their home is located much closer to work--my fiance and I live much farther away. I received the vaccination around 10AM Sunday morning. Sunday night I went to bed around 8:30PM and experienced severe chills throughout the night. I awoke around 12AM and got up to get a drink. I got a drink of water and checked my temperature, temp was 100.7. I felt yucky but not horrible. I walked back to my parents' room to tell them I would be staying home from work. As I got to their room and began to speak, I began to feel nauseous and weak and suddenly collapsed. My dad leaped up and helped me stand up so I could get to the restroom. I walked a few steps and then collapsed again and lost complete consciousness--I do not recall collapsing again or what happened shortly after. Per my dad, I was unresponsive, and he drug my limp body from his bedroom to the bathroom. My mom called 911. After several minutes, I regained consciousness and was leaning against my dad in the bathroom. I felt my fever break and was sweating profusely. EMS arrived at my home and checked vitals--everything was stable. I was A&O x3 and was able to drink water. I declined being transported to the hospital. I felt the loss of consciousness was likely due to dehydration or fever (although my fever really wasn't that high).

23 2021-01-26 dizziness Pt reported Headache, feeling of lightheadedness and dizziness 20 minutes after receiving immunizat... Read more
Close
Pt reported Headache, feeling of lightheadedness and dizziness 20 minutes after receiving immunization. She was monitored for 30 minutes and symptoms improved every 5 minutes and Vital signs were normal. She did not develop any rash, swelling, itching, throat discomfort or difficulty swallowing. No cough or dyspnea. No Nausea or vomiting. -She was placed in exam room, supine on exam table with legs bent at knee. VS were monitored continuous pulse and pulse ox and blood pressure every 4-5 minutes. VS remained normal. She drank 12 oz. water after 5-10 minutes She also had came to the clinic right after working a night shift and did not drink much fluid that morning. Her symptoms appear to be a vasovagal response. She left the clinic after 30 minutes in stable condition with resolution of dizziness, light headedness and headache was mild.

Could not eat all day. 1/27- woke up with headache and slight body aches but otherwise felt okay during the day. Was hungry and able to eat. Starting at 10:00pm my stomach began to hurt again. Experienced bloating, sharp stabbing pain and nausea. Felt like I needed to vomit or pass a bowel movement but could not do either. Took Zofran at 11:00pm, did not help in relieving my GI symptoms. Still on round-the-clock extra strength Tylenol. Could not eat all night. 1/28- woke up still with headache, and mild-moderate stomach pain. Able to eat a couple bites of food.

23 2021-01-29 dizziness I received my second dose of the Moderna COVID vaccine at approx. 10:40 AM on Friday, January 29 at ... Read more
Close
I received my second dose of the Moderna COVID vaccine at approx. 10:40 AM on Friday, January 29 at clinic. By 12:00 PM, I noticed that I developed facial swelling, which was most significant around my eyes, and I felt lethargic. Between 12:00 PM and 2:00 PM, I developed hives on my neck, chest, stomach, and arms, which prompted me to take 1/2 of a dose of 25mg Benadryl. Nonetheless, the symptoms persisted and I began to experience dizziness and tightness in my throat around 4-5 PM, which was when I was advised by a nurse to go to the emergency room for treatment. I arrived at Hospital's Emergency Department around 6:00 PM and I was treated for "Possible Allergic Reaction Major." I received diphenhydrAMINE (BENADRYL) injection 50 mg, famotidine (PF) (PEPCID) injection 20 mg, methylPREDNISolone sodium succinate (PF) (SOLU-MEDROL) injection 125 mg, sodium chloride 0.9 % iv bolus, and acetaminophen (TYLENOL) tablet 650 mg. I was discharged after 10:00 PM and sent home with a prescription for predniSONE 20 mg and famotidine 20 mg. My facial swelling and hives have gone down but neither have completely resolved since being discharged. I am also experiencing full body aches and fatigue at this time (3 PM on Saturday, January 30).

I got the shot at about 7:25pm on Saturday and then was scheduled to work the next morning, Sunday, at 4:30 am. I had not felt great from the moment I got up on Sunday, and felt progressively worse throughout the day. I had really bad body aches and chills, to the point where I was shivering, even with three layers and a puffy coat on. I normally never get cold. I also had a really bad headache. By the time my shift was over at 1pm, I wasn?t even sure I could trust myself to drive home. Eventually I decided it was fine, but by the time I got home I felt so terrible that it took me at least 15 minutes to get out of the car. I took a hot shower and went to bed. I was shivering violently, even with lots of blankets, and couldn?t even sit up to drink some water. I laid in bed for hours, doing absolutely nothing and feeling miserable. I got up after 7:00 pm to eat some dinner and felt so nauseous that I was dry-heaving into the toilet.

Close
I am almost a licensed pharmacist so I am aware of what was going on with my body* I started with a sore arm and fatigue on the day of vaccination. The following morning I woke up and got dressed and used the restroom. I proceeded downstairs to make my coffee. As I was doing so I became dizzy and nauseous. I sat down on the floor and then I lost my vision and hearing. I broke out in a profuse sweat and had no concept of time. My boyfriend was with me and said it took 5-10 minutes before I began to normalize. I apparently had shallow breathing and turned pale white including my lips, I slowly regained awareness although I never fully lost consciousness. 911 was called and paramedics arrived. by this time I had begun to normalize with most of my vision returning. I ended up declining to see medical attention because I normalized and told the paramedics I would seek attention if it came back. * please note the physician listed is my PCP but I was not seen for this reaction.

Patient received her first dose of Moderna Covid-19 vaccine in left deltoid. Approximately 5 minutes later the patient began feeling extremely dizzy, hot, and started to have severe nausea. Her blood pressure was elevated (153/110) initially and continue to remain elevated. She decided to have us call EMS to be transported to the hospital.

From patient note: 2/19/21 Day of Vaccination - Morning of the vaccination had burning in arm at and around the injection site with severe soreness of arm developing over the day. After 5 hours faintness, sore neck/shoulders, trembling hands, "super shaky", also headache with stabbing pain in head and neck which continued for several days. Tight chest developing within 3 hours gradually turning into extreme difficulty breathing by 9pm. Around 9pm both arms from shoulders to fingertips went numb and tingly "like nerves were TV static". Throughout night drank about 1 bottle of water per hour, each time getting up and taking a few steps vision would start blacking out, would feel clammy, and would barely make it back to bed before fainting. Extreme muscle and joint pain made walking difficult for 3 days.. Fever of 99-101 for 3 days. 23 2021-02-23 mobility decreased Joint pain and cracking at shoulder lasting a whole week now. After receiving my injection, I notice... Read more
Close
Joint pain and cracking at shoulder lasting a whole week now. After receiving my injection, I noticed that it was given very high up on my arm, just barely 1 finger width's away from my shoulder joint. As a healthcare provider myself, I know to be aware not to administer too high as this can result in shoulder injury. I unfortunately seem to have encountered this firsthand myself. I wanted to wait a week hoping the pain would go away, but it is still there even after a week. It was severe pain starting about 36 hours after receiving the shot, then for two more days, the pain was about 8/10. The pain has become less severe over time, but I am unable to use my left arm to the same capacity anymore due to this constant shoulder joint pain. Prior to this, I have never had any shoulder pain.

Patient called Health Dept 3/2/2021 at 9:30 am reporting reactions after receiving first Moderna vaccine on 2/26/21. Patient received vaccine at approximately 10:20 am on 2/26/21. She reports that a few minutes after receiving vaccine that her throat felt really dry. It felt 'like when you wake up from anesthesia'. She had no breathing problems so she didn't think much of it. About an hour after receiving vaccine, she went through a drive thru to order food and 'wasn't thinking right, like I had brain fog'. That lasted a short time. About an hour after receiving vaccine, patient noticed lips and mouth were tingling 'like I had ate something really spicy'. This lasted off an on for about an hour. Later that evening, patient felt dizzy and nauseated. She laid down and took a nap and woke up feeling better. Skin started to feel itchy that night. On 2/27/21, patient woke up with an itchy rash all over back. Rash is still there. No other symptoms at this time.

No muscle soreness either.

23 2021-03-14 dizziness Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA I received the vaccine on 3/13 at 3:45pm and began experiencing symptom... Read more
Close
Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA I received the vaccine on 3/13 at 3:45pm and began experiencing symptoms on the day at 5:30pm including dizziness, nausea, fatigue and wiped-out exhaustion, drunk-like dazed and confused, body heaviness, and developed soreness in the muscle of the right arm where the injection had been administered. The symptoms progressed at 6:30pm to include general muscle soreness, muscle twitching on the right side of the body especially on the right upper thigh, increased appetite, malaise, headache, and chills in addition to the aforementioned symptoms. At 7:30pm the nausea and increased appetite improved with food and fluid intake but sleepiness, yawning, confusion, chills, and fatigue worsened at 8:30pm. Temperature at 9:30pm was 95.7 degrees Fahrenheit and a pale, green-like, clammy appearance was visible on the general skin. At 10:30pm the sleepiness reversed to restlessness and insomnia to the point of hyperactivity, and the appetite increased four-fold along with rash up and down the injected arm, numbness and tingling in the injected arm, chest discomfort with palpitations, anxiety, headache, stomach pain, malaise, and general limb edema which all persisted until I was able to fall asleep at 6:30am on 3/14. Many of the aforementioned symptoms improved upon wakeup time at 4pm on 3/14, but extreme sleepiness with nausea, dizziness, fatigue, head pain and right eye pain, and palpitations with chest discomfort persisted until 10am on 3/15, during which time only the nausea, dizziness, and fatigue persisted.

3:30am woke up feeling nauseous, within seconds of standing up lost vision and balance, ran to the bathroom and fell. Woke up in a different spot with a bit of black eye from falling. Woke up and felt very out of it and not sure of things. Drank a lot of water but a few hours later, got up and felt nauseous again like I was going to pass out again. Fever of 101.8 F. Lots of body aches and chills. Sweating like no other.

23 2021-03-21 dizziness Within about 5 minutes of patient receiving the vaccine, she began to feel dizzy and nausea. She pr... Read more
Close
Within about 5 minutes of patient receiving the vaccine, she began to feel dizzy and nausea. She proceeded to have several episodes of vomiting afterward. She was treated with oral Benadryl 25mg PO x1, but vomited afterward. She was later administered Benadryl 25mg IM x1 and Zofran 4mg ODT x1 with improvement in her symptoms. Vital signs remained stable throughout 2 hours of observation and she was discharged home. Subsequent telephone follow-up indicated patient's initial symptoms continued to improve by the evening and the following day. Patient never developed syncope, rash/hives/SOB/lip, tongue or throat swelling.

The next morning, I had a severe tightening of the left side of my neck and shoulder, along with arm soreness. I saw my Physical Therapist and was told that it was a result of the vaccine. I was fine until I got the vertigo Friday evening. It came on really quickly and I've never experienced it before. I was okay the next morning with the exception of a headache, which lasted for about a month after that. My doctor offered shots for them, but I couldn't take them due to my current meds. I was told to come back if they continue.

Close
23 y.o. female has a past medical history of Anxiety and Depression. Who was a proceed out after receiving her first vaccine for Covid. Patient reports a long history of of fainting with vaccines in the past. She received the first vaccine and about a minute later started to feel diaphoretic and lightheaded. She had to sit herself down and staff at the vaccine clinic lifted up her legs. Ended up doing repeat vitals with initial blood pressure of 60 over palp. She was cool and clammy at that time. She denies any nausea or flushing. At the time of my evaluation in the bouncing clinic, blood pressure had improved to 85 over palp with 2+ radial pulses bilaterally. Patient was then transferred to emergency department for observation. At the time of transfer she started to feel back to baseline. She denies any cardiac history, drug use, decreased p.o. intake, family history of cardiac disease, sudden history of cardiac death, bleeding, black or bloody stools. She is unsure of her last menstrual period.
23 2021-03-31 dizziness Patient received first dose of Moderna COVID19 vaccine at 1030 via IM injection in left deltoid. Pri... Read more
Close
Patient received first dose of Moderna COVID19 vaccine at 1030 via IM injection in left deltoid. Prior to injection, patient reported being nervous about fainting. She reported no prior history of fainting due to vaccination or blood draws; she "passed out" two years prior to dehydration at a music festival. Approximately four minutes after injection, patient stated that she was going to "pass out" and had an episode of syncope. She exhibited pallor, dry heaving, and arm contractures. The nurse helped her to a supine position on the floor and called for assistance. The nurse team encouraged deep breathing and provided apple juice, pretzels, ammonia inhalent, and cool washcloths. EMS was called and arrived at 1045 for further assessment. Patient reported that she had not consumed any food or drink prior to vaccination and stated that her hands were "tingly". EMS took blood pressure and heart rate; both were within normal range. The patient was taken to the hospital by EMS at 1055, where providers determined that syncope was likely caused by anxiety. Patient returned home and reported feeling tired but stable when health department called to check in at 1400.

Close
Patient received vaccine at 6:03 pm, patient was in recovery area and experienced syncope at 6:07 pm, patient fell to the group face down, nurses responded turned patient on left side, patient had 5-10 second seizure with full body seizing and eyes rolled backed. EMS called. Right frontal area hematoma due to hitting head on floor. Patient confused at first, BP 98/64, HR 80 at 6:10, patient diaphoretic, reassessed BP 105/60 HR 82, EMS assessed, patient LOC returning A&Ox4, able to remember she does have seizures and takes seizure medications but cannot remember medication name. Nurses advised patient to be transported by EMS, patient refused, patient boyfriend and mom also refused and stated they would take her themselves. Boyfriend to drive patient to ER for follow up per patient and family.

Close
I have been experiencing intense upper arm pain from my shoulder to my elbow. I am not able to lift my arm. My blood work shows inflammation markers and low levels of ANA and IFA markers. I did not have any of these symptoms or markers before taking the vaccine. I am not able to go to work. I have seen a primary care physician and a neurologist. When taking the steroid Prednisone, the pain does subside, but I am not allowed to take a steroid for more than one week. I stopped taking my second dose of Prednisone 4 days ago, and now all the pain has returned and I cannot lift my arm. This situation is frustrating and scary. The doctors do not have a diagnosis or treatment plan. Pain relievers do not help at all.

Somewhere between 5-8pm the, began to feel feverish and got a headache, mild body soreness. Required ibuprofen 200mg x1. Overnight had a fever and two episodes of sweating, chills, shaking. Felt hyperalgesia when I would wake up (normal for me with viral illness). Day 2: resolved completely by morning. Arm soreness: Day 0: not too bad Day 1: peaked around 5pm, limited ROM due to pain, swollen at site. Decreased as other symptoms increased. Day 2: still mildly sore but no need for meds or limit in ROM. Day 3: mild pain persists, no other sx
24 2021-01-08 dizziness awoke at 2 am with nausea, chills, generalized pain. Immediately felt myself start to pass out or h... Read more
Close
awoke at 2 am with nausea, chills, generalized pain. Immediately felt myself start to pass out or have a seizure- I am not sure which. Family member reports my eyes were open with absent stare however I lost consciousness, <60s. My right calf was in a severe muscle spasm as soon as I became conscious which leads me to believe I had some convulsions. Nausea chills and generalized pain persisted throughout the rest of the morning. Stopped around 10 am and turned into pounding headache and fatigue. Additionally my left arm is in moderate to severe pain (not like the typical soreness I get with the flu shot). I am in significant pain moving my arm, but also changing body positions while keeping my shoulder still and close to my body (bending over, scooting over in bed).

Close
1 hour after vaccination client complained of dizziness, swelling of right hand. No general s/s of anaphylaxis noted. Pt was given juice, crackers and asked to rest in recumbent position. Symptoms did not improve and 12.5 mg of benadryl IM given in opposite arm of injection. After 15 minutes same general symptoms present; another 12.5mg of benadryl IM given again in opposite arm of injection. Pt remained lying down and 20 min after 2nd dose of benadryl patient reported feeling improved and able to ambulate independently. And monitored in her workplace without further intervention.

Immediately after receiving the vaccine I felt fine. Around 7 pm that night I began having body aches that continually worsened throughout the night. At 2 am on Saturday I took my temperature and it was 101.6 F, at 3 am it was 102 F. The body aches, joint pain, fever, and headache continued through the next day until about 6 pm on Saturday. Also on Saturday around 12 pm I began experiencing severe nausea, abdominal pain, and dizziness. At one point it felt as if I was going to pass out. All the major symptoms finally subsided Saturday night around 6 pm. Saturday till Sunday I have felt fatigued and sore but otherwise fine.

24 2021-01-12 dizziness After receiving the vaccine i just felt pain on my right arm. Took 600mg of ibuprofen around 8:30pm ... Read more
Close
After receiving the vaccine i just felt pain on my right arm. Took 600mg of ibuprofen around 8:30pm and went to bed. Upon waking up the next morning (today) at 7am, I felt very weak. I ate breakfast by 8am and head to work. The weakness persisted, by 10am when I went to the restroom I felt as if i was going to collapse from how weak I felt while standing. Felt some chills as if my chest was breathing in cold air. By 10:40am I was home in bed resting. Had a moderate headache and chills, weakness persisted. At 12:50pm I had a fever of 100.9 F. I drank water, took 600mg ibuprofen and ate an orange. Around 2pm I felt strong enough to get up and take a short walk. At 3:00pm my temperature was 99.8 F, chills were gone. Weakness had improved. No more headache. At 4:45pm temperature at 99.2 F. And feeling better. I took lunch around 3pm
24 2021-01-13 dizziness called to Car after vaccine due to patient not feeling well. Quick history obtained: No pmh. Not pre... Read more
Close
called to Car after vaccine due to patient not feeling well. Quick history obtained: No pmh. Not pregnant per patient. nly allergy to milk. No history of anaphylaxis. She received vaccine at 5:42. Felt lightheaded and dizzy about 5 to 10 minutes after the vaccine. She noted chest tightness and tachycardia symptoms. We transported her via gurney to our observation area. She looked sleepy and had trouble arousing her. Blood pressure is 140/80, heart rate was in the 90s to 100s. Breath sound decreased bilaterally. No lip swelling. No rash. She noted throat felt uncomfortable. Suspect anaphalxis reaction given rapid decline in status while talking with her. epic pen at bedside immediately and then due to increasing heart rate and complaints of chest discomfort gave her epipen times one. Paramedics were called prior to decision for Epipen. She noted after a minute or two her chest felt better. Monitored her and blood pressure remains stable 140/80's, heart rate initially increase to 110 and then back down to 100 about 5 minutes after the first dose. Second dose of EPI readied as Paramedics not on site yet. At about 8 minutes from EPipen dose her heart rate increase to 160 and she noted additional symptoms of chest tightness again and re-gave a second Epinephrine pen. She was more somnolent but protecting airway. Oxygen was added 2 liters after second epi pen. Her sats dropped right around second epi pen to 94% but about 2-3 minutes later back to 98%. Paramedics arrived 5 minutes after 2nd epi dose and care was transferred to them. She was transported in stable condition. Once paramedics arrived it was determined that they got a level 3 request which was not as urgent and this should have been a level 1. We reviewed how this happened and they note that our site was listed as a level 3 site due to having staff on hand. We were advised to ask for LEVEL 1 paramedics in futures. This was communicated to all Medical staff as well as the Physician of the day orientation.

Close
?Within the first 15 minutes - injection site felt hot (right arm). ?Within the first hour - right arm felt heavy with some numbness/tingling that lasted less than 10 minutes. ?3 hours post vaccine - mild arm soreness with ROM, but not to the touch. ?7 hours post vaccine - I felt very fatigued. I could have gone to bed at 1600. I could barely keep my eyes open. ?8 hours post vaccine - fatigue was still very much present, moderate arm soreness with ROM and now to the touch. I felt very feverish, but was afebrile. ?10 hours post vaccine - fatigue was a little better because I had taken an hour nap. Body aches and headache had set in, and I still felt feverish without a fever. I couldn?t stop shivering. I needed to be under multiple blankets with long sleeves, pants and thick socks on to feel even a little bit warm. ?13.5 hours post vaccine - fatigue and body aches had worsened. It?s a struggle to go from laying to sitting and sitting to standing. I even fell back down to the couch a few times because I didn?t have the strength to stand up all the way. Right arm soreness has progressed enough that lifting up a water bottle was a struggle, and I could not lay on my right side. My temp is now 101.4°. ?I tossed and turned between 0200-0630 shivering and aching all over. I slept with my entire body (even my head) under the blankets to try to stay warm. My head was throbbing. I got up at 0630 to take some Tylenol and woke up sometime between 0630 and 1030 drenched in sweat, so I?m assuming I had another fever. ?30.5 hours post vaccine - it?s now January 1st. Body aches/stiffness, headache, fatigue, right arm soreness still very present. Switching any type of body position was a struggle. Temp is 101.2° now. I got out of bed at 1045 and got back in bed at 1200. I stayed in bed until 1845. ?48 hours post vaccine - slight headache and right arm soreness. Right arm ROM is very doable again. My neck, shoulders and hips are sore, but much better. Fatigue is gone. I?m able to move around fine without any struggle. I still have SOB from March, but I feel like over the last 24 hours it?s worsened a bit.

24 2021-01-24 dizziness A few hours after the first dose (1/15), a welt grew around the injection site about the size of a s... Read more
Close
A few hours after the first dose (1/15), a welt grew around the injection site about the size of a silver dollar. This went away after three days. Arm was sore for the first two days. One week later (1/22), injection site became itchy, red and was very warm to the touch. A welt formed as well. It started out the size of a silver dollar, and over the course of 48 hours the welt, itchiness, and redness grew to the size of a large russet potato (Friday 1/22- Saturday1/23). It was the most red around the injection site, with the most red being about the size of a silver dollar. After 48 hours, it remained itchy, red, and had a welt for the next 24 hours (Sunday 1/24). The next morning (Monday 1/25) redness and swelling were gone but site was still a little itchy. Site was only slightly tender throughout these three days but not painful. No other side effects were noticed i.e. fever, chills, chest pain. Slight dizziness was felt if I hadn't eaten anything.
24 2021-01-25 dizziness Patient reported: A fast heartbeat; Dizziness and weakness; Fever CHIEF COMPLAINT: FEVER (pt... Read more
Close
Patient reported: A fast heartbeat; Dizziness and weakness; Fever CHIEF COMPLAINT: FEVER (pt received second dose of covid vaccine on 1/20 at 1800, fever and chest tightness, history cardiomyopathy); presented to ED following day at 04:30 AM. Briefly this is a 24-year-old with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy myopathy without obstruction presenting with fevers, chest tightness, and rigors after her 2nd COVID vaccine yesterday. She took Tylenol at home yesterday and on presentation this morning she already felt better. Her chest tightness was no longer present on admission and did not recur. EKG relatively unchanged from prior studies. She was febrile with an initial temperature of 39.3° C and tachycardic to 110. She was given 1 g of Tylenol and 15 mg Toradol as well as 2 L normal saline. Her temperature came down to 37.1 and her heart rate came down to 90. Subjectively she felt a lot better and was comfortably sitting upright in her bed. Her blood pressure on admission was 105/58 and had dropped to 91/45, she was given an additional 1 L of normal saline (for a total of 3L) and her blood pressure improved to 103/46. She was able to ambulate without dizziness. She was discharged home with instructions to return if she significantly worsened, developed shortness of breath or experience recurrence of her chest tightness.

Close
24 y.o. female who arrived to the emergency department for an allergic reaction after receiving the COVID-19 vaccine today. Patient states she received the first dose of the Maderna vaccine in her left arm around 0910 hours this morning. Patient waited 15 minutes afterwards and within 30 minutes was back working in the trauma unit. However, she suddenly began to experience nausea, chest tightness, palpitations, shortness of breath, throat tightness, light headed, and overall shaky. Patient states she further went down to the vaccine clinic to inform them of her symptoms in which she was prompted to come to the ED for evaluation. She was not given an Epi pen prior to arrival. Patient reports overall feeling better now with only continued tingling in her tongue and fingers, as well as feeling mildly light headed. Patient also states her throat continues to feel tight, but denies any throat swelling. Chest tightness and palpitations have since improved, only with occasional flutters in her chest similar when feeling excited. Denies nausea, rash, itchy skin, or abdominal pain. No history of anaphylaxis or allergic reactions. Patient is prescribed Nexium, but denies taking any other daily medications. Physical exam shows to be unremarkable with no rash or throat swelling/erythema. Patient does not appear in respiratory distress. Lung sounds are clear. Will order an EKG. Will administer IV Epipen and IV Benadryl. Differentials: Allergic Reaction EKG shows NSR with sinus arrhythmia. Otherwise normal with a rate of 87 bpm. Patient was observed in the ED for 3 hours with improvement of symptoms. Provided follow up instructions to clinic list. Discussed return precautions. Vital signs are stable at time of discharge Initial Vital Signs [01/28/21 1019] Blood Pressure 132/91 Heart Rate 85 Respiratory Rate 24 Temp 36.6 °C (97.8 °F) Temp src Oral SpO2 99 %

Patient presented for her 2nd COVID vaccine at 17:30 and indicated she had hives after the first dose of vaccine. She was pre-medicated with Benadryl 25 mg for her second dose at 17:37. Her second dose was given at 18:15 and was held at the vaccination site for observation. Pt. developed symptoms at 18:32 and c/o tightness in chest, SOB, itchiness, and hot feeling across her back and upper shoulders. Pt. indicated that she felt like "passing out", and was eased to the floor with Medical First Response activated. Epi 0.3 mg IM into L. Thigh and Benadryl 25mg IM on L. arm was given at 18:40. She was transported to the ED subsequently. Pt. was treated w/ decadron, famotidine in the ED and was discharged at 20:55. 2/4/2021- Doing well today overall. No further intervention after the ED visit.

24 2021-02-05 gait disturbance, dizziness On January 21 I received my first dose of Moderna vaccine on my left arm. After the vaccine I had a ... Read more
Close
On January 21 I received my first dose of Moderna vaccine on my left arm. After the vaccine I had a red lump that was hot and a bruise that only lasted 2 days. Everything was fine until the January 28th when I developed a large red lump during the day while at work that was severely itchy and hot. When I got home from work I had a low grade fever. I made an appointment with my primary care for the next day which was Friday the 29th. My doctor told me she believes I had cellulitis. I was given an antibiotic 2x a day for 7 days. She drew a purple circle around the area and told me that if it goes outside the marked area or I feel any new symptoms, to go to the emergency room. Saturday morning on the 30th i woke up to my entire arm red and hot. I felt like I had a huge sunburn. I couldn?t put my sweatshirt on because it was so hot. The emergency room doctor told me I was fine and to keep taking the antibiotics that were given to me yesterday from my primary care doctor. After the emergency room I went to work and started to feel dizzy and nauseous. My hands became sweaty but the rest of my body was cold. I started having a butterfly feeling in my chest. My Apple Watch alerted me that my heart rate was over 100 bpm. That night before bed I had another low grade fever. On Sunday the 31st I noticed the red area was gone but instead it was a dark purple. I felt okay Sunday besides a rapid pulse. Monday February 1st I woke up out of a dead sleep sweating, butterfly feeling in my chest and dizzy. I tried to take my pulse while laying down but it was so fast I couldn?t keep up with it. I put my Apple Watch on which alerted me immediately that my pulse was 152 bpm. I slowly got up but then I passed out falling off of my bed. I couldn?t get any words out because my heart was beating so fast that I couldn?t breathe. I was sweating horribly and had a hard time walking. Had absolutely no strength in my left hand, my arm was purple/red, cold and numb. My arm felt like someone punched me repeatedly and gave me a dead arm. I called my primary doctors office and they were able to get me in that afternoon. All morning my pulse was spiking and then drastically dropping. About an hour and a half before I went to the doctor everything was fine. I was able to talk but still struggled with breathing while talking. The doctor ordered an EKG which came back clear. My pulse and blood pressure was also fine. The doctor told me she believed all of the symptoms I had were from the medication I take at night (doxazosin-to relax my muscles and help with sleep.) She also told me she believed some of it was my mental health issues taking over. She told me the cellulitis looked fine and sent me home. Later that day I felt exhausted and when I woke up from a nap, I had a fever of 100.5. Took Tylenol and it dropped to 99.5 but wouldn?t go any lower. February 2nd I woke up to a large red ring outside of the purple marker, numb finger tips and butterfly feeling in my chest. All day I received alerts that my pulse was falling and spiking. I sent my primary doctor an email and she told me she didn?t think it was cellulitis anymore, maybe a hematoma but she wasn?t sure. Since January 28th I still struggle everyday with the butterfly feeling in my chest, blurry vision, low grade temps, alerts of pulse, dizziness and breathing difficulties. My arm is always hot, my finger tips are numb and sometimes the strength in my hand is gone. The top of my arm is always a dark purple with red blotches and other times my entire arm is red and hot. When my pulse is very fast, I have a hard time talking, remembering what I was going to say and focusing. I?ve had multiple coworkers ask me if I?m okay because I?ll randomly stop talking and stare off and then I?m alerted that my pulse has either spiked or dropped drastically after spiking. My pulse is never consistent. It is always ranging from 57-155bpm. I realized at first I may have what they call ?COVID arm? but my symptoms haven?t gotten any better. No answers have been given to me or a diagnosis. The first diagnosis that they thought was cellulitis. Then it was ?in my head and behavioral.? Then it was a hematoma. Now it?s an ?I don?t know.? I have tried Benadryl for the itching, ice packs for the days that I?m swollen, Tylenol for the fevers and pain but I never have any relief.
24 2021-02-05 gait disturbance, mobility decreased I got the first dose of the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine at 3pm 1/13/21. I was fine for the 30 minutes a... Read more
Close
I got the first dose of the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine at 3pm 1/13/21. I was fine for the 30 minutes after, not even sore at the injection site. Around 6pm, my muscles started aching, but not painful enough to be concerned. At 3am 1/14/21, I woke up in pain in every muscle. Enough to wake me, but not terrible. At 7am, I noticed a pinpoint pain in my armpit, and my muscles still ached. At 9:30am, I took ibuprofen to attempt to curb the pain a bit. Around 10am, it got so painful I was limping, and having trouble bending down or reaching above shoulder height. At 11:30am, I noticed the pinpoint pain in my armpit had gotten worse, and there is a hard, approximately quarter-sized round lump in this spot. Very painful. At 2:30, I went to move my shirt sleeve and the pain at the injection site was so intense I screamed when I touched it. This pain continued until 1/16/21 when I woke up feeling entirely normal. Since 1/16/2021, my hands have been randomly stiffening, either completely stretched out and dropping anything in them, or closing tight enough to leave fingernail marks on my palms. I will also reach to grab things and my hands will sometimes bend into odd shapes, instead of what I intended for them to do. This began at 1-2 times a day, and is becoming more often. It is now up to 2-4 times daily.

Then, upon follow up with PCP, medication for pain relief was prescribed as followed: ibuprofen 800 mg and Gabapentin. Pain has subsided but remains upon slight movement of shoulder.

the first day (1/16/21) following the first dose of the vaccine, i began experiencing nausea. the third day (1/18/21) i vomited that morning once but then not again throughout that day. after that for about two weeks, i was just generally nauseous and also had no appetite. food tasted off to me. this went away after two weeks, but then i got my second dose on 2/12/21. on 2/13/21, i spent about 12 vomiting very consistently, about every 10-15 minutes. i also had chills alternating with profuse sweating and hot flashes, but did not ever have a fever. other symptoms included headache, extreme fatigue, dizziness, body aches, shortness of breath, and chest pains. the next day, i was fine aside from some slight lingering nausea but no vomiting. since then, i have experienced nausea intermittently every day, and have vomited on more than a dozen of those days. i have no appetite, and have now lost ten pounds since getting the second dose. i realized that my main food aversion is to meat, i will vomit every single time i eat meat now. i?m not sure if this is my reaction to the texture and taste like i think it is, or if it?s actually more like an allergic response by my stomach. i also still struggle with shortness of breath and feeling like my chest is tight, as well as dizziness and a nagging cough.

24 2021-03-14 dizziness I received my second dose at 12:15pm on 03/06/2021. By about 9-10pm I began feeling chills. I went t... Read more
Close
I received my second dose at 12:15pm on 03/06/2021. By about 9-10pm I began feeling chills. I went to bed and my body wouldn?t warm up under the covers. I woke up around 1:16am feeling very hot. I was running a fever of about 102F. After removing the covers and using a cold compress it dropped to the 99F range and fluctuated quickly between about 98.7F-99.9F. I continued to have chills and feel very cold during this fluctuation. When I would stand to go to the bathroom my body would be very weak and I would get almost lightheaded. I fell asleep by about 3:30am. The following morning my fever was completely resolved. I continued to feel weak during the first half of the day with some mild intermittent nausea. By the second half of the day my side effects resolved entirely.

I am not sure if the acne cream got in my eye the night before the vaccine. it is called Retin A cream 0.025%. I have also been feeling very weak. I got a B12 injection on my butt for energy(Friday, march 12). My legs feel like they are in pain and the hurt when I walk. I also had a lot of pelvic pain after the vitamin injection. I drank ibuprofen March 14 at night. I woke up feeling very weak. Before going to bed on March 15 I drank Tylenol. I still feel pain in my legs today and now I have lower back pain.

24 2021-03-17 fall, dizziness Patient came to the center for a Moderna vaccine at 5pm. The patient expressed that she felt dizzy ... Read more
Close
Patient came to the center for a Moderna vaccine at 5pm. The patient expressed that she felt dizzy shortly after immunization (before leaving the immunization chair). Her head began to fall backwards so I quickly supported the patient's head and neck area and was able to keep her from falling out of her chair. The patient fainted but regained consciousness approximately 3 seconds later. The patient came back alert but nauseous. The patient vomited in a trashcan and then felt fine. The patient blamed the reaction on her severe anxiety and said the exact same thing happened after a nose piercing. I observed the patient for 30 minutes and sent her on her way. The patient left healthy and happy. I told the patient to warn the pharmacist prior to receiving her second dose. No drugs were administered. Written up in SCRT and VAERS. I followed up with the patient at 7 pm and she was home safe.
