Close
Dizziness, nausea, disorientation onset 10-15 min after vaccine - informed official at vaccination site & monitored me (took blood pressure, heart rate, listened to lungs) Symptoms became worse 30 minutes after vaccine - severe nausea and dizziness, very disoriented, feverish, throat started to swell - nurse had me lay in a comfortable reclining chair, put a fan on me and continued to monitor/take vitals Called the paramedics due to throat swelling becoming worse Paramedics assessed me again, vitals were normal, but took me to the hospital to be checked further Received 25mg of Benadryl once admitted to emergency - PA assessed me and gave me 3 prednisone to stop and further reaction Prescribed the Benadryl and prednisone , was discharged

24 2021-03-28 dizziness Patient was vaccinated around 10:55 AM. Within a couple of minutes she started feeling lightheaded, ... Read more
Close
Patient was vaccinated around 10:55 AM. Within a couple of minutes she started feeling lightheaded, sweaty, and had blurry vision while sitting. She reported no history of blood sugar issues, but she said she only had some donut to eat today. I initially gave her three glucose tablets and a bottle of water, which she sipped. She reported feeling better within a few minutes. I checked her blood pressure at 10:59 AM. It read low at 81/44 with a pulse of 73. But, I checked again since I doubted the accuracy of the reading. The second reading was 101/56, with a pulse of 79. Patient said she was feeling better, but continued to sit. I gave her one more glucose tablet to equal a total of 16 g of carbs given. She sat for at least fifteen minutes until she felt well enough to get up and shop. She checked back after shopping and said she was fine.
24 2021-03-29 dizziness Dizziness, muscle aches, headache
24 2021-03-30 dizziness, vertigo Passed out/passing out; Vertigo; Uncontrollable muscle twitching all over body; Dizziness/lightheade... Read more
Close
Passed out/passing out; Vertigo; Uncontrollable muscle twitching all over body; Dizziness/lightheadedness; Clammy hands/feet; Diarrhea; Gas; Rapid heart rate; Tingling in both feet/Tingling in bilateral feet; Liquid in both ears; Tiredness/fatigue; Nausea; Chills; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer, concerning a 24- year-old female who received Moderna's COVID vaccine and passed out and developed vertigo, dizziness, lightheadedness, uncontrollable muscle twitching, chills, clammy hands/feet/cold sweat, tingling in bilateral feet/paresthesia, fatigue ,nausea, liquid in the ears/ear discharge, diarrhea and gas/flatulence. The patient's past medical history was not provided. Products known to have been used by the patient, within two weeks prior to the event was reported as multivitamins (ascorbic acid, colecalciferaol, cyanocobalamin, pyridine hydrochloride, retinol palmitate, tocopherols mixed). On 04 March 2021 , prior to the onset of the event, the patient received first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (lot number:13A21A) intramuscularly for prophylaxis of COVID 19 infection. On an unknown date after receiving the first dose of the vaccine the patient passed out which was considered as serious event (medically significant). The patient also experienced vertigo, dizziness, lightheadedness, uncontrollable muscle twitching, chills, clammy hands/feet ,tingling in bilateral feet, fatigue ,nausea, liquid in the ears, diarrhea, gas and tiredness. The patient reported that she passed out 30 seconds later after getting injection and it was not due to vasovagal reaction. As per patient, tingling started when she woke up early in the morning but in feet only. Treatment medications include dimenhydrinate and paracetamol. The patient took water and electrolytes for hydration. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to events was considered as unknown. The outcome of the events passed out and developed vertigo, dizziness, lightheadedness, uncontrollable muscle twitching, chills, clammy hands/feet/cold sweat, tingling in bilateral feet/paresthesia, fatigue ,nausea, liquid in the ears/ear discharge, diarrhea and gas/flatulence was considered as unknown.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of these events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
24 2021-03-30 dizziness Patient said she felt that she was going to pass out. We sat her on the floor, applied a cool compre... Read more
Close
Patient said she felt that she was going to pass out. We sat her on the floor, applied a cool compress to head and wrists. A couple minutes later she was feeling better, but she was asked to remain sitting for another 10 mins to monitor her. She claimed to be dehydrated, and had not eaten much of anything today. Her friend brought her some water and food. After eating a bit and drinking the water she said she was feeling almost normal. We provided a motorized cart for her even though she said she was fine to walk. I gave the patient a follow up call a few hours later and she claimed to be feeling fine.

couldn't sleep; Felt sick; Fell; Body went stiff; Hit head on the wall; Vomiting; Fainted; Had seizures twice; Back pain; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of SYNCOPE (Fainted) and SEIZURE (Had seizures twice) in a 24-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included COVID-19 in October 2020. On 02-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 02-Apr-2021, the patient experienced BACK PAIN (Back pain). On 03-Apr-2021, the patient experienced SYNCOPE (Fainted) (seriousness criterion medically significant), SEIZURE (Had seizures twice) (seriousness criterion medically significant), INSOMNIA (couldn't sleep), MALAISE (Felt sick), FALL (Fell), MUSCULOSKELETAL STIFFNESS (Body went stiff), HEAD INJURY (Hit head on the wall) and VOMITING (Vomiting). At the time of the report, SYNCOPE (Fainted), SEIZURE (Had seizures twice), BACK PAIN (Back pain), INSOMNIA (couldn't sleep), MALAISE (Felt sick), FALL (Fell), MUSCULOSKELETAL STIFFNESS (Body went stiff), HEAD INJURY (Hit head on the wall) and VOMITING (Vomiting) outcome was unknown. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Intramuscular) was unknown. For mRNA-1273 (Intramuscular), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. Labs included Electrocardiogram: and Urine analysis, no test results provided. Treatment information not provided. Company comment: Very limited information regarding these events has been provided at this time. Further information has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Very limited information regarding these events has been provided at this time. Further information has been requested.
24 2021-04-28 dizziness, inability to stand Approximately 24 hours after the injection, I began having persistent ice pick headaches, which last... Read more
Close
Approximately 24 hours after the injection, I began having persistent ice pick headaches, which lasted 1-2 hours. I have a history of these, but they are almost never so intense. About 25 hours after the injection, I began having intense pain in the center of my chest. It dissipated and returned a couple of times over the next 5 hours or so. The pain was so great that it was difficult to stand, and I came close to passing out. I have not experienced this severe level of pain since about 30 hours post-injection.

Close
That evening my arm swelled up and became very painful - not as much as the first vaccine. I had a hard time sleeping - nausea and headache throughout the night. 4/3 - extremely tired; felt like I couldn't get enough air (shortness of breath) body aches and muscles aches - over all lethargic. 4/4 - I was dizzy, short of breath . Those two symptoms lasted along with fatigue - which lasted for two days. I almost passed out that day - everything went black and I had to be assisted to the couch to recover from that. I used Tylenol for my symptoms when needed. I still have ongoing headaches - three weeks ago (about a week after I got the vaccine) - I noticed I was having ongoing headaches and I still have these. Pregnancy - 2nd pregnancy; 1st one was full term. Date of delivery expected - September 9, 2021.

25 2021-01-06 injected limb mobility decreased ?Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA? The day I got the vaccine all that happened was a dead arm and then w... Read more
Close
?Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA? The day I got the vaccine all that happened was a dead arm and then when I was driving home after the 15 minutes of waiting in the parking lot, I got a metallic taste in my mouth, but it didn't last very long. The next day my arm was sore to move, but not at the injection spot, if looking at my arm (someone else) it was down 3 inches and to the left about 1 inch. The next day that same spot was still sore but to the touch, then it went away. What is more interesting and concerning is that on 1/6/2021 (a week after I got the shot), I noticed 3 little bumps on my arm (9:45pm), in that same location that was sore to move and touch on day 2 and 3 but they also were itchy. When I woke up the next morning (6:15 am) the area had spread to the size of my palm (3 inch by 3 inch roughly) it was all red, hard to the touch, stilly itchy and I had the feeling of a dead arm again. One of the nurses at my work drew a circle around the red spot so we could watch to see if it was still growing , by roughly 11:45 am it had grown an additional 2 inches.

I received my shot at 2:30 pm. A few hours later my arm was very painful. I could hardly move my arm and it kept me up all night. Around 4 am I had a sore throat and a stuffy nose. At about 7 am I had a headache, fever of 37.6 Celsius, chills, and horrible body aches.
25 2021-01-08 dizziness, balance disorder Symptoms began with arm soreness with minor swelling around the administration area around 6-7 pm. C... Read more
Close
Symptoms began with arm soreness with minor swelling around the administration area around 6-7 pm. Chills began at 11 pm lasting for half an hour followed by a fever of 102f. The fever continued during the night of 1/5/21 and early morning of 1/6/21. Woke with a strong headache in the morning at 7 am. Headache caused dizziness and some loss of balance when walking. Had minor facial swelling with minor numbness around mouth and neck. The fever, headache, and swelling continued throughout the day of 1/6/21. The fever broke around 7 pm on 1/6/21. Nyquil and ibuprofen were taken for fever and headache. During the morning of 1/7/21, the fever and facial swelling had ended. The headache continued during the morning of 1/7/21 until midday. By the evening of 1/7/21, all symptoms had ceased.

25 2021-01-08 joint range of motion decreased I walked in to received my first dose of the Moderna Covid19 vaccine at approx 12:20pm 1/7/21. The R... Read more
Close
I walked in to received my first dose of the Moderna Covid19 vaccine at approx 12:20pm 1/7/21. The RN who was giving me my injection palpated the top of my shoulder and NOT my acromian process and administered the injection closer to the top of my shoulder, the vaccine did initially hurt more than a typical vaccine would when it was being administered but i thought that might have been normal. Approximately 1hr after receiving the vaccine my left shoulder joint started to have this pinching sensation in the anterior joint when I would raise my arm forward. The pain got progressively worse throughout the day with significantly decreased range of motion in that shoulder and significant pain in my shoulder joint. The pain was so bad it actually kept me from sleeping that night. I never had any muscular pain or any other symptoms beside the joint pain, which was alarming since it should have been administered into the muscle. I believe the vaccine my have been incorrectly injected into the shoulder joint or potentially a smaller muscle in the shoulder. The pain and decrease ROM is preventing me from doing most of my regular day to day activities. Today 1/9/21 has been a full 48hrs after receiving the vaccine and the joint pain has not gotten any better and my range of motion is still significantly decreased, which would prevent me from performing my tasks as an RN.

Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA. Patient's aunt called me and told me that niece (patient) is 25yo having issues with coordination about a week after 1st Moderna vaccination shot. Unsure of exact vaccination date and onset of symptoms. really having to focus to place hands under water to wash them, walking through doors without bumping into them, turning on faucet, getting dressed; left hand is worse than right and not able to easily align things properly; "feels like her brain isn't doing what she's telling it to do". Aunt said the symptoms are not improving. Patient had tested negative for Covid the day she got the vaccine.

25 2021-01-12 dizziness Received the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine on Wednesday 12/30/2020. Sunday 1/3/2021 started with some diz... Read more
Close
Received the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine on Wednesday 12/30/2020. Sunday 1/3/2021 started with some dizziness. On Tuesday 1/5/2021 developed hives on feet and ankles. Dizziness worsened and hives had spread to hands and wrists the following day. Upon arriving to work on Thursday 1/7/2021, hives had progressively gotten worse and I was tachycardic. Called employee health where I was instructedto go to the ED. Was tachycardic 100-130 bpm and hypertensive 156/112mmHg upon arrival to the ED. Received IV Benadryl and Decadron for the reaction/hives. Viotals were normal upon discharge. Continued with Prednisone and benadryl. Taking Meclizine to help with dizziness.
25 2021-01-13 dizziness Vasovagal syncope (loss of consciousness) Tonic seizure (tensing and twitching of arms) Irregular he... Read more
Close
Vasovagal syncope (loss of consciousness) Tonic seizure (tensing and twitching of arms) Irregular heartbeat (per EKG) Extremely low blood pressure I received the vaccine at a public health pop-up, drive through clinic for first responders - I accessed the vaccine through my employer as a first responder. The vaccine was administered to my left arm without complication at approximately 1:00pm (my scheduled appointment). I proceeded to the area designated for patients to be observed after receiving the vaccine and was asked to wait 15 minutes. I recall getting to the observation area then telling my spouse I felt unwell - after the event he notified me that I told him I was about to pass out and asked him to get medical help. I lost consciousness approximately 5-10 minutes following the vaccine. My husband reported that after losing consciousness I seemed to have a minor seizure, as evidenced by my head jerking and my arms and fingers "tensing and curling up". I was sitting in the passenger seat of my car at this time, so I suffered no fall or fall related injury. Public health officials and EMT responded. They indicated to my spouse that I had experienced a vasovagal syncope episode and that I had "gone tonic"/ had a "tonic seizure". They took my blood pressure, which was very low (I don't recall exactly but it was 80 over something). They also took my blood sugar among other things that I do not recall. I was given oxygen and put into an ambulance. I was shaking, so they wrapped me in blankets. I believe they may have done an EKG and placed a blood pressure cuff while I was in the ambulance, but I do not recall any specifics about this. The EMT also drew my blood, placed an IV, and administered IV fluids while I was in the ambulance. I was taken by ambulance to the emergency department

Close
Client has a history of vaso-vagal reactions to blood draws and vaccinations. Post vaccination she was seated in the passenger seat in vaccine pod observation lot and felt like she "was going to pass out". Her husband got the attention of the paramedic overseeing the area. She did not become unresponsive at any time but became very pale. Her BP was 80/40 when initially checked. EMS was call and she was shortly thereafter taken to a local ED via non emergent transport. Her husband had driven her to the pod site and did not receive a vaccination. She was discharged home yesterday.

I received my vaccine around 12:45pm. They had me go to waiting room and wait for 10 mins. I sat down and was waiting for a few minutes when I started to get dizzy. I looked up and told the lady checking people in ?hey I?m getting really dizzy can I lay down? she said yes come in the room. When I stood up my heart started beating really fast. I sat on the table and my chest started feeling tight and heavy. There were 2 ladies in the room at this point so I asked one of them if they had an epipen on hand just in case. My throat wasn?t swelling but it was getting harder to breath from the tightness in my chest. She said they didn?t have an epipen and would have to call emergency services if I needed one. I told her I didn?t know what was going on, that I didn?t need one yet but she should probably call emergency services if they can?t do anything to help me. (ER is right across the street) my symptoms went away shortly after they called. But came on a couple more times but much milder over the next 30 minutes or so. The EMT gave me Benadryl and the ER ran some tests.

25 2021-01-14 dizziness Patient was observed for 15 minutes after vaccination with no adverse effects during that time perio... Read more
Close
Patient was observed for 15 minutes after vaccination with no adverse effects during that time period. Patient experienced throat closing, tightness in back of throat, dizziness, light headedness, heart racing approximately 20 to 25 minutes following vaccine. Adverse effects were sudden in onset. Patient was in her car when adverse event started. Patient called 911, ambulance arrived, EMS administered epinephrine IM. Patient was given 50 mg of diphenhydramine orally 30 minutes after event. Patient reported no breathing issues within 3 minutes of epinephrine. Patient reports no other problems following that except for feeling jittery.

25 2021-01-17 dizziness Several minutes after the vaccine she became light headed, EMT evaluated her and stated she was tach... Read more
Close
Several minutes after the vaccine she became light headed, EMT evaluated her and stated she was tachycardic (did not give a pulse) and was initially unable to find a BP. She appeared pale and was crying and hyperventilating. She stated she had a funny feeling in her throat and numbness in her fingers. We prepared to administer an epi-pen but she was increasingly anxious so we had to place her in a supine position first. Immediately she started to feel better, her color was normal and her blood pressure was 110/70 with a pulse of 67. Her throat no longer felt ?funny.? We continued to monitor her and did NOT administer epinephrine. An ambulance arrived and she was ambulatory and feeling normal so declined transport. Follow-up with patient 1/18/21, she states she is feeling good. She said she and her mother both have a history of passing out with any procedure involving needles and she does not feel her symptoms were caused by the vaccine itself. She plans to receive her scheduled 2nd dose from us.

25 2021-01-19 dizziness PT began shaking immediately after vaccine administration. RN stayed in room with Pt to monitor symp... Read more
Close
PT began shaking immediately after vaccine administration. RN stayed in room with Pt to monitor symptoms. Ten minutes later, Pt reported feeling dizzy. She was placed in a recumbent position on the exam twith legs elevated and vital signs were obtained, they were within normal limits. Pt then reported that it felt like she had something in the right side of her throat - she declined epinephrine injection. RN and LVN stayed at bedside. Pt then stated that both sides of her throat felt blocked and gave consent for epinephrine injection. RN administered 0.3 mg epinephrine and activated EMS. Vitals signs, breathing and circulation monitored closely until EMS arrival. Pt was transported by ambulance to the hospital emergency department for evaluation.

The staff from another of our own company facility had come for getting vaccinated at this Clinic. She did not wanted to go to Urgent Care at that time but we advised her if she does not feel good, she should go to Urgent Care.

About 30 min after the vaccination I felt dizzy. It felt almost like I had gotten up too quickly and felt dizzy, that kind of dizziness. Around 9PM the cold chills were so awful I started crying because it was so uncomfortable. I took some Tylenol and it knocked me out. I felt cold and hot during the night. About 7AM the next morning I had hives, on my chest, arms and legs (red itchy, swollen) the chills have gone away in the morning. I took an Allegra around 8AM and it did work after 30 min to an hour. Then I went to see my allergist around 11AM and the itchiness and redness had gone down a lot but the itchiness was still there. The allergist told me to take some more Allegra that day and it ended up working.

Close
My arm started to hurt at the injection site at about 7PM. It hurt to touch and put pressure on it. I woke up around 1AM on the 31st feeling cold and went back to sleep, but I couldn't lay on the arm that had the injection due to the pain in my muscle. I woke up again at 3AM with chills, cold sweats, and body aches; it felt like I had a fever but I don't own a thermometer so I can't say for sure. Later in the day on the 31st, I did not have an appetite and when I tried to eat, I experienced nausea. Even the slightest touch to the injection site caused pain and I couldn't raise that arm. My fatigue, aches, loss of appetite, nausea, and chills lasted until January 1st. The pain in my arm lasted for another week or so before I could lay on it or touch it. To this day, if I scratch the injection site or accidentally bump into it in the exact spot I received the shot, it will cause pain that I did not experience before.

Approximately five minutes after receiving the shot, I began to feel a burst of pain rush through my entire left arm. A few seconds afterwards, I started to feel nauseated. Immediately, I felt weak, light-headed, and tired. I began to sweat profusely, as well. I could barely move my arm to flag down one of attendants who was monitoring us. She asked me what was wrong, and I tried to describe what was going on, but I could barely talk or keep my eyes open. She radioed for help and the paramedics came over to me. They wanted to move me to a private room and asked if I could walk. I tried to walk there, but I started to fall so one of the paramedics hoisted me up to help me. They asked me some questions will they were waiting for a stretcher, all of which I could hear and understand, but I was unable to response to. The stretcher came and I laid down, but I was already starting to feel better by then. I was very out of it, but I think this entire process took maybe 10-15 minutes. I laid there for maybe another 15 minutes, and I began to be able to talk again and open my eyes. I tried sitting up and that went alright. I answered some questions for them while they took my blood pressure, monitored my pulse, and took my temperature. After another 15 minutes or so, I felt well enough to walk back to my office in the Health Department. I didn't have any other problems for the rest of the day.

Close
7:09 patient received COIVD 19 vaccine after vaccination patient monitored by medical staff 7:20 patient c/o lightheadedness, dizziness, SOB and difficulty swallowing. patient brought into exam room at that time. Sp02 at 7:25 was 99% on RA, pulse 133 patient assessed by RN, shaky, clammy skin, no visual swelling of neck or mouth, tachycardia noted. 50 mg benadryl IM given by RN at 7:25 vitals retaken at 7:30 pulse:99 SpO2:98 on RA, BP: 140/96 Patient D/C at 8:09 with VSS. NP states continue dosing 2-4 hours with benadryl 50 mg for the first and depending on how she feeling 25 to 50 mg there after.

25 2021-02-04 dizziness, impaired driving ability Patient arrived at 12:14PM. Observation nurse noticed patient with eyes closed with hand raised on ... Read more
Close
Patient arrived at 12:14PM. Observation nurse noticed patient with eyes closed with hand raised on top of head. Patient was lethargic and weak, AOX3. Patient stated "I am not able to see anything." while patient's eyes were open. Apical pulse very faint. Patient felt the urge to vomit and suddenly appeared flushed in the face. Patient stated "I feel better." immediately after experiencing nausea. 12:25PM - BP 97/67 Patient reiterated her experience stating: "I felt lightheaded and felt like I was about to faint.", "I felt heavy and foggy." Patient was given water to drink and a cookie. 12:35PM - Patient reported pressure on both sides of head and "weird" (as per patient) visual changes. Patient stated "Everything has a glare." Patient reported prior reactions to past vaccinations: Flu and Tetanus - experienced lightheadedness, fainting and visual changes. Indicated reactions were "more worse" than prior reactions. 12:45PM - BP 115/78 HR 64 SPO2 98% Patient was asked to sit closer to nurse an was able to ambulate with no issues and steady gait. 1:15PM Patient reports to feel "Back to normal." denied any symptoms including visual changes. Patient contacted her parents to be driven home. 1:37PM Walked patient to her parent's car outside the convention center. Instructed to go to ER/Call 911 if symptoms persist or get worse. 2/3/21 The next day patient texted nurse observer that she is feeling much better from yesterday after resting and taking Advil.

Felt faint, sat with head between legs for 1 minute, then passed out on the floor. Woke up 30 seconds later and vomited. Still felt lightheaded 10 minutes after adverse event. Called EMS and went to Emergency Room.

25 2021-02-04 vertigo, gait disturbance, dizziness As soon as I got the vaccine I was able to taste the vaccine,. Within 5 minutes I felt dizzy and wit... Read more
Close
As soon as I got the vaccine I was able to taste the vaccine,. Within 5 minutes I felt dizzy and within 15 minutes I couldn't feel my arm. I got a rash throughout my whole arm, and was warm to touch as well as a tingly sensation in my whole arm. It passed on to my right arm and started losing sensation and the tingly feeling started as well. Within 45 minutes I started breaking out throughout my whole body, within 1hr 15min. my legs felt weak and I couldn't walk. I felt dizzy, the whole room was spinning. They were going to send me to the hospital but I didn't want to go and I went home and injected myself with an EPI pen. and also took 2 Benadryl's. I started feeling my throat close but not all the way, I could feel I was having an allergic reaction. I just had a really bad headache and went to sleep from the Benadryl . I woke up with my eyes little swollen, and a rash on my left arm and chest area, my whole body was very itchy. This lasted for two days. The doctor at my work said if it got worse to go to ER and or urgent care. They didn't recommend me getting second dose.

Close
felt fine besides soreness after vaccine. My 9pm I felt dizzy, had a headache, and started feeling nauseous I took some Tylenol and ibuprofen and a snack (can?t take it on an empty stomach when nauseous Was able to fall sleep but woke up at 2am very shaky, nauseous, and with extreme joint pain. I went to get a snack so I could take more pain reliever and I passed out and briefly blacked out my vision. When I came to, all the lights in my apartment were on but I had to use my hands to feel where my bed was so I could get back in. My TV was on but I realized that I couldn?t hear it. All I could hear was a buzzing/wooshing sound and realized my hearing was gone and when I scratched my head and I couldn?t hear the sound on my scalp. It came back about 30 minutes later but happened again the next time I stood up. By around 4am I was in so much joint pain I couldn?t lie down anymore and had to run a bath so I could relieve some of the pain. I?m still in a lot of pain but I don?t have the nausea anymore as strongly.

25 2021-02-07 balance disorder, movement disorder, gait disturbance, dizziness Brain hemorrhage (inflammation, swelling); Dizziness; Difficulty with coordination; Difficulty with ... Read more
Close
Brain hemorrhage (inflammation, swelling); Dizziness; Difficulty with coordination; Difficulty with balance; Vision changes in left eye; Drift in left arm; Issues going through daily routine; Neurological symptoms; Was confused; Headaches; Very nauseous; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer, who was a 25-years-old, white female patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced the events, very nauseous, neurological symptoms, headaches, dizziness, difficulty with coordination, difficulty with balance, vision changes in left eye, drift in left arm, issues going through daily routine, confusion, and brain bleed. The patient's medical history, as provided by the reporter, included gluten allergy. Products known to have been used by the patient, within two weeks prior to the event, included ethinylestradiol/ ferrous fumarate/ norethindrone acetate. On 06 Jan 2021 at 10:30am, prior to the onset of the events, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 intramuscularly in the left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 06 Jan 2021, after receiving the vaccine, the patient became very nauseous through 08 Jan 2021. On 09 Jan 2021, the patient started having neurological symptoms. She started having headaches, dizziness, difficulty with coordination and balance, and vision changes in the left eye (not specified). She reported that she had a "drift" in the left arm and described it as "when you try to manipulate the arm, but it does not go where you want it to go". On 11 Jan 2021, the patient still had neurological symptoms, issues moving left arm, colliding with objects all day, and issues going through daily routine. On 12 Jan 2021, the patient was seen by a neurologist and magnetic resonance imagining (MRI) was scheduled. The MRI revealed inflammation, and brain bleed and swelling. The patient was sent to the emergency room and admitted on 19 Jan 2021. Treatment for the events included calcium carbonate for nausea, ibuprofen for headaches and diphenhydramine. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not reported. The event, very nauseous, was considered resolved on 08 Jan 2021. The events, neurological symptoms, headaches, dizziness, difficulty with coordination, difficulty with balance, vision changes in left eye, drift in left arm and issues going through daily routine, confusion, and brain bleed were considered not resolved. Follow-up received on 23 Jan 2021 included patient details, medical history, lab tests, concomitant medications, hospitalization, and updated events.; Reporter's Comments: This case concerns a female patient, who experienced a non-serious unexpected event of dizziness, coordination abnormal, balance disorder, visual impairment, movement disorder, loss of personal independence in daily activities, and neurological symptom, and non-serious expected event of nausea, and headaches. The events of nausea occurred 1 day (same day) after first dose of mRNA-1273, lot # unknown. The event of neurological symptoms, dizziness, coordination abnormal, balance disorder, visual impairment, loss of personal independence in daily activities, and movement disorder occurred 3 days after first dose of mRNA-1273, lot # unknown. Treatment for the events included, Tums, nauseam, ibuprofen and Benadryl. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and onset of the events a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

25 2021-02-08 gait inability Paralyzed on the right side down to her foot; Numbness in her hands and feet; Slurred speech; Felt r... Read more
Close
Paralyzed on the right side down to her foot; Numbness in her hands and feet; Slurred speech; Felt really heavy in her face area, hurt really bad; Shooting pain; Feels tingly; Felt really heavy in her neck, hurt really bad; unable to walk; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer who was also a 25-year-old female patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 Vaccine (mRNA-1273) and developed heaviness in her face and neck, numbness in hands and feet, slurred speech, completely paralyzed on her right side, right fingers tingly, unable to walk and shooting pain feelings. The patient's medical history was not provided. Concomitant product use was not provided. On 21 Jan 2021, approximately two hours prior to the start of the events, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot 032L20A) intramuscularly in the right arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. Approximately two hours after receiving the vaccine at 12:30 pm, the patient experienced heavy feeling in her neck and face area that hurt really bad. Later, she noticed numbness in her hands and feet. Slurred speech was reported from a bystander. By 3:30pm, the patient was completely paralyzed on her right side. She was taken to the hospital, and a code stroke was initiated; however, all labs were normal. On 26 Jan 2021, the patient was still paralyzed on her right side, unable to walk, had shooting pain feeling, and two fingers on her right hand were able to move but still felt tingly. The doctors planned to discharge her on the next day to a rehab center because she could not function alone. Treatment for the event included pain medication and hospitalization. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not reported. The outcome of the events, developed heaviness in her face and neck, numbness in hands and feet, slurred speech, completely paralyzed on her right side, right fingers tingly, unable to walk and shooting pain feelings were considered unknown.; Reporter's Comments: A spontaneous report concerns a 25-year-old, female, patient, who experienced heaviness in her face and neck, numbness in hands and feet, slurred speech, completely paralyzed on her right side, right fingers tingly and shooting pain feelings. The events of heavy feeling in her neck and face area, numbness in her hands and feet, slurred speech, completely paralyzed on her right side occurred on the same day after the administration of the first dose of mRNA-1273 (Lot number 032L20A, expiration date unknown). The events of inability to walk, had shooting pain feeling and two fingers on her right hand were able to move but still felt tingly occurred the following day after the vaccine administration. Treatment included pain medication and outcome is unknown. Based on the information provided, which indicates a strong temporal association between the reported events and administration of mRNA-1273 vaccine (onset latency of 2 hours), a causal association cannot be excluded.

Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA Three days following the injection I had most of the symptoms. The injection site was hot, hard and quite painful (I couldn't sleep on that side of my body for three nights). I felt generally unwell and achy. After about three days all of my symptoms went down and most of them were gone except for I could still feel a small amount of swelling under the skin that continued to go down. On Tuesday Feb 10, almost a week out I started to experience an itching feeling that increased throughout the day to a deep itch that feels like it goes down to my bone. The injection site has become red, hot and hard again and the lymph node in my left armpit is extremely painful and swollen. I feel dizzy and nauseous.

25 2021-02-18 dizziness Starting about 5 minutes after receiving the vaccine, I felt feverish (no fever), lightheaded and di... Read more
Close
Starting about 5 minutes after receiving the vaccine, I felt feverish (no fever), lightheaded and dizzy. The doctor on site had me wait for an hour until I felt well enough to drive home. Over the next several hours, my lightheadedness became so bad I felt as though I would faint if I stool for longer than a few minutes. On Saturday, 2-13-21, I did pass out on the stairs and again in my livingroom. On Sunday, 2-14-21, I decided to go to urgent care in which I was told to "wait it out". However, my symptoms had gotten worse over the last couple days to include body aches, headaches, muscle/joint pain, congested sinuses, slight cough, and feeling feverish (no fever) along with being dizzy. Therefore, I went to the ER later that morning 2-14-21, to see if I could get better treatment for my symptoms. I received IV fluids and they preformed blood work, a urinanalysis and an ECG. I was released from the ER around 8pm. My symptoms were better for the remainder of the evening, but have gone back to what I was feeling before for the last several days. My symptoms have been unresolved now for 1 week. I am getting tested for COVID-19 on Saturday 02-20-21.

25 2021-03-12 dizziness Paresthesia of hands and feet, purple colored toe and fingernails, feeling of heavyweight on chest w... Read more
Close
Paresthesia of hands and feet, purple colored toe and fingernails, feeling of heavyweight on chest with lightheadedness. Symptoms were at their worst Monday and slowly dissapated over the next 72 hours.
25 2021-03-12 gait disturbance, vertigo, dizziness Initially sore arm and chills around 8pm. Around 2 am notes Fever, chills, body aches all over, a ki... Read more
Close
Initially sore arm and chills around 8pm. Around 2 am notes Fever, chills, body aches all over, a killer headache, nausea and I could not stay asleep. I took 2 extra strength Tylenol at that time, put an ice pack on my forehead, and drank a Pedialyte. In addition to those, at about 4 I had ringing in my left ear and then lost the hearing in it. I just went to bed. When I woke up, around 10am on Friday, I could hear, but super dizzy. I couldn?t really walk without feeling like I?m going to fall over, especially with turns. All symptoms continued throughout all of Friday. I continued to take the Tylenol per the instructions on the bottle with my last dose around 5pm, I also drank 3 more pedialytes throughout the day in addition to plenty of other fluids. Took a warm shower around 7PM which seemed to help some with body aches and chills, however, dizziness/vertigo remained. Saturday I woke up several times drenched in sweat. Around 9am my fever was gone. Still feeling a little ?off? in terms of balance/vertigo but nothing compared to Friday. Slight body aches remain. Other symptoms gone.
25 2021-03-14 dizziness pounding heart, heart rate increased; panic; Total body flushing; Sensation of hot and cold; Shaking... Read more
Close
pounding heart, heart rate increased; panic; Total body flushing; Sensation of hot and cold; Shaking; lightheadedness; feelings of passing out; nausea; arm numbness; extremity tingling; headache; exhaustion; fever; fluctuating blood pressure; racing heart ,heart palpitations; mild flushing; brain fog; A spontaneous report was received from a healthcare professional concerning a 25-years-old, female patient, who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced panic, rapid pulse, pounding heart, total body flushing, shaking, a sensation of hot and cold, lightheadedness, and feelings of passing out, nausea, extremity tingling, and arm numbness, headache, brain fog, racing heart, heart palpitations, fluctuating blood pressure, mild flushing, exhaustion, and fever. The patient's medical history, was not provided by the reporter, but patient had a tuberculosis test done in recent days prior to vaccination, reports were not provided. Concomitant medications reported included vitamin B-12 complex and ibuprofen. On 04-Mar-2021 at 5:55 pm, prior to the onset of the events, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot number: 013A21A) intramuscularly in the deltoid for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 04 Mar 2021, approximately after 23 minutes after receiving the vaccine patient developed panic, rapid pulse, pounding heart, total body flushing, shaking, a sensation of hot and cold, lightheadedness, and feelings of passing out. Patient pulled over and called 9-1-1, and she was taken by ambulance to a nearby hospital. Patient had reported that the symptoms persisted during ambulance transit and continued during her three hour hospital stay. Patient reported to have development of nausea, extremity tingling, and arm numbness while being admitted. Patient reported that a friend of her drove her home from the hospital, and her brother was monitoring her condition. No medicinal treatments were administered at the hospital for the patient. On 05 Mar 2021, Patient took advil to treat the headache and brain fog that has developed. Patient reported that the symptoms headache, brain fog, racing heart, heart palpitations, fluctuating blood pressure, mild flushing, exhaustion, and fever were continuing. As treatment for events no medicinal treatments were administered at the hospital. Patient reported that she had taken ibuprofen to treat a headache and brain fog. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was unknown. The outcome of events, panic, rapid pulse, pounding heart, total body flushing, shaking, a sensation of hot and cold, lightheadedness, and feelings of passing out, nausea, extremity tingling, and arm numbness was unknown and headache, brain fog, racing heart, heart palpitations, fluctuating blood pressure, mild flushing, exhaustion, and fever were not recovered.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
25 2021-03-15 mobility decreased Around 6:00 pm on the day of vaccination I started to feel very fatigued and developed body aches - ... Read more
Close
Around 6:00 pm on the day of vaccination I started to feel very fatigued and developed body aches - this felt similar to the beginning of developing Covid-19 symptoms. (I had Covid-19 back in November of 2020) Around 8:00 pm I had developed some head congestion and swollen lymph nodes along with some throat pain and sinus congestion - again feeling very similar to Covid-19 symptoms. Around 10:00 pm as I was heading to bed the symptoms became a lot worse, I had pretty intense body aches and started to experience chills as well as a slight fever (around 99.5 in F). At this time the symptoms felt similar to how I had felt during the worst of my previous Covid-19 symptoms, very weak and achy, headache was very bad, and felt very uncomfortable overall. Around 2:00 am on March 13 I woke up with a fever of 101.8. The previous symptoms had also gotten worse, I was having a hard time getting out of bed because things were very uncomfortable, I drank a lot of water and took some ibuprofen to combat the fever, about an hour after this the fever had come down to about 99.9 and I was able to fall asleep, but before taking the medication I couldn't have fallen asleep because of the discomfort of the aches, chills, and fever. Throughout the following day I was unable to complete many of my day to day activities without taking a daytime cold and flu medication. With the medication I still felt sick but was able to walk around and complete some simple household chores, this carried through into the evening, when the medication wore off the chills and aches and headache were much worse and I still had a fever around 99-100. That night I was able to sleep with the cold and flu medication taken right before bed. Upon waking up the next morning (March 14) I still had some congestion, headache, and general discomfort but the worst of the aches were gone and I no longer had a fever, these symptoms continued to diminish throughout the day. On March 15 and March 16th I have had a slight lingering congestion headache, this also feels really similar to the lingering headache I had upon recovering from Covid-19. It is not debilitating and is continuing to improve. Otherwise I am feeling healthy again and have been able to complete my usual activities and even exercise. Overall the symptoms felt like a couple days of having Covid-19 again, but recovery was much faster, and it was definitely worth receiving that first dose of the vaccine and getting started with the process of doing my part to reduce community spread.
25 2021-03-16 dizziness Lightheadness and dizziness within 15 minutes of injection.
25 2021-03-17 dizziness Client received Moderna second dose vaccine at 2:10 pm. Stated no problems with first dose. Had a hi... Read more
Close
Client received Moderna second dose vaccine at 2:10 pm. Stated no problems with first dose. Had a history of numerous allergies including anaphylaxis to mold but no injectables. instructed to wait 30 minutes. After about 10 minutes, client complained of trouble breathing, dizzy and itchy mouth. Nurses noted extreme trouble breathing . EPI 0.5 ml given SQ in left leg. Blood pressure 189/90, P 138 02 sat 99%. No wheezing noted. Skin clammy. 911 called. BP better at 130/82 P 110 and 02 sat 100%. Clients breathing improved. Cool compress applied to head and elevated legs. Client was alert. EMS arrived at 2:35 pm and transported client to ER.
25 2021-03-18 dizziness A few minutes after receiving the shot I noticed extreme tiredness and light headedness. I got up to... Read more
Close
A few minutes after receiving the shot I noticed extreme tiredness and light headedness. I got up to notify staff and my vision went and I began to feel nauseated. They helped me to a seat and I began sweating profusely and the nausea intensified. After several minutes the nausea and vision changes subsided and I continued to feel extremely tired and light headed. The staff put a heart rate monitor on me and I saw that my heart rate was sitting around 38-42. I felt like I just wanted to close my eyes but the staff kept asking me questions. After several more minutes a cop arrived. Later on an ambulance arrived and when they put the blood pressure cuff on I noticed tingling in my hand from it. I continued to feel light headed and extremely tired through arriving at the hospital via ambulance around 10:30am. These symptoms gradually subsided throughout the afternoon leaving me with light headedness only when walking or moving around. While at the hospital they did an EKG which showed inverted T waves (from what I remember of the PA's description) and so admitted me for observation and performed an echo which came back normal. I was discharged around 10pm on the same night.

Saturday morning, my head was dizzy and no appetite. But took some meal around 9.30 a.m. Then I started vomiting from 12 p.m. to 3 p.m. several times. My whole body was dizzy and tired for a whole day.
25 2021-03-21 dizziness Patient was sitting in observation room 15 min following covid-19 vaccination, she appeared anxious... Read more
Close
Patient was sitting in observation room 15 min following covid-19 vaccination, she appeared anxious and complained of light headedness. noted with facial flushing and mild appearance of hives. H/O shellfish allergy, hospitalized with anaphylactic reaction twice in the past after eating shrimp. Denies nausea, no vomiting or difficulty breathing. No itching, tongue heaviness or throat swelling. Benadryl 50mg PO administered immediately. vital signs as followed BP 134/86 pulse 101. repeated BP 126/77, pulse 92. third BP reading 112/73, pulse 81. o2 sat 99% . respiratory rate 18. She was closely monitored for another hour, repeating vitals signs every 15 mins, symptoms resolved, states she feels fine, left facility stable in uber. Instructed to follow up with PCP for further evaluation and discuss alternate setting for 2nd covid 19 vaccination. Instructed on when to seek medical assistance.

Patient still light headed and her rash has now spread to her anterior neck and chest. Patient taken to another building. Patient was able to ambulate. No shortness of breath, no stridor, not itchiness 02:42 Benadryl l 25 mg PO given as per MD orders BP 155/87 HR 122 RR 20 SpO2 100 RA. Water provided and well tolerated 02: 45 Patient laying in bed, resting comfortably/ 02:58 Rash is gone, no redness seen. BP 145/77 HR 103 RR 20 SPO2 99

Patient received first dose of Moderna. More than half of the first dose leaked out due to faulty syringe. Nurse called over charge nurse to verify that more than half of the dose had not been administered to the patient. Charge nurse confirmed that second dose was approved after confirming with FD. Patient consented to 2nd dose. Patient informatoin was collected by charge nurse. Shift nurse proceeded to administer 2nd dose. Left arm was used to administer. Patient was in stable condition. Nurse explained after-care. Patient began to hyperventilate and said she felt like she was going to faint. Patient asked for water. Patient said she had a history of fainting and was going to faint. The patient fell on her right side off the chair after approximately 10min. of sitting upright in the chair in the observation area. Pt. was able to answer orientation questions asked by EMT . Pt. reported right sided pain s/p fall. Pt.'s skin was pale with redness in areas of impact. Pain rated @ 3/10, non-radiating, "soreness" quality. After 12 minutes PPTS was reassessed and EMT took vitals, BP: 118/82, HR: 76, RR:18, SpO2 99% .

25 2021-04-01 dizziness These were symptoms after 2nd shot. I started with a mild headache and sore arm. Then things got wo... Read more
Close
These were symptoms after 2nd shot. I started with a mild headache and sore arm. Then things got worse. At night on Wednesday, 24th, I got a severe headache that was at the back of my neck and could feel in the back of my head. Then I became so achy. My bones and joints hurt so much. It hurt to sit or lay down. All I could feel is the pain in my joints. I became so weak and so achy that I could barely get up and walk to the restroom. I could it stand for more than 2 minutes due to the pain. The subsided slightly on Thursday night, 25th, at 6pm. But then returned in another way. I became very nauseous and dizzy. My muscles instead of my bones began to hurt extremely. I could barely move. I broke down crying a couple of times due to the pain being so intense. Throughout this time, I did try to eat or snack and continue to drink water and Gatorade. Then finally the pain just all of a sudden went away on Friday, 26th, at 1:00pm. I felt like a different person. The pain was gone. The only lingering effect was when I would get up from sitting down, I would be dizzy and my head would throb for a few seconds. That went away on Saturday night, 27th. I will say if that type of pain had continued on much longer, I might have had my husband take me to the Emergency Room.
25 2021-04-01 dizziness I received my first Covid - 19 vaccine on March 25, 2021. The next day I felt extremely dizzy starti... Read more
Close
I received my first Covid - 19 vaccine on March 25, 2021. The next day I felt extremely dizzy starting around 4:00pm. This was able to be resolved by increasing hydration. The following morning I felt much better with no other side effects. Just over a week later (4/2/21) I woke up around 7:00am and noticed a rash around the injection sight. It is not itchy but it feels warm and hard to the touch. The shape is somewhat of an irregular oval about two inches long and an inch wide. I also have a smaller circular spot just below the larger spot. The rash is currently only located on my left arm right near the injection site.
25 2021-04-01 dizziness Client described electric pain in her arm which traveled up her arm to her neck and head, feeling li... Read more
Close
Client described electric pain in her arm which traveled up her arm to her neck and head, feeling like a migraine for a moment and then disappearing. Her vision blurred; she felt dizzy; she had a hard time hearing herself, although she could hear me fine; and she felt faint. We had her sit back down and got her some water, checking on her every 5 minutes or so. She was still dizzy, but not as faint. She also reported a cold sweat. We got her some orange juice and continued checking on her. She called her husband to come and get her. She was able to get up and walk out of her own accord with her husband. We will follow up with her tonight to see how she is doing.

25 2021-04-04 dizziness At about 5 pm same day I started getting fever it was 101. I decided to drink some orange juice and ... Read more
Close
At about 5 pm same day I started getting fever it was 101. I decided to drink some orange juice and when I went to sit back down I started feeling extremely dizzy, I got a very bitter taste in my mouth, my whole body started tingling and my lips and tongue and hands especially started feeling numb.I managed to get to bathroom floor where I grabbed some water and wiped it over my neck but I continued to feel worse where I couldn?t even control what my body was doing and I had diarrhea. The ?snow? in front of my eyes got worse too where I couldn?t almost see anything for over probably 3 minutes and I broke in cold sweat.After the diarrhea I had a very sharp pain in my lower abdomen. That all lasted a few minutes and I didn?t have phone on me and I was alone so I helplessly sat on the floor through it all til I started feeling bit by bit better.The fever continued for 48 hours as well as extreme arm pain for 3 days where I got my vaccine.

25 2021-05-10 dizziness Approximately 10 minutes after the patient got her second moderna vaccine she became faint and dizzy... Read more
Close
Approximately 10 minutes after the patient got her second moderna vaccine she became faint and dizzy. The patient was sitting at the time. A law enforcement officer witnessed her becoming faint and ran over to attend her. I was called over to assess her as well. The law enforcement officer called EMS. The patient stated that she felt faint, dizzy, she said she had a headache, blurry vision, and was nauseous. The patient appeared sweaty and she appeared to loose consciousness briefly twice. She did not show any signs of redness, rash, or swelling. After sitting for a few minutes, and before EMS arrived, the patient said she was improving. She did not lose consciousness anymore but she still had a headache, nausea, and blurry vision. When EMS arrived they recommended that she get checked out at the emergency room, but the patient refused stating that she did not want to go to the hospital and that she was feeling better. The patient called her parents and they came and picked her up.
25 2021-05-19 dizziness fainted; Can't do a lot,has been staying in bed; Dizzy; Aches and pains; Fever of 102.5 degrees; rig... Read more
Close
fainted; Can't do a lot,has been staying in bed; Dizzy; Aches and pains; Fever of 102.5 degrees; right arm soreness; Vomiting a little; very nauseous/nausea; Headache; Dry heaving; She can't drink a lot of liquids; Can't keep food down; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of SYNCOPE (fainted) in a 25-year-old patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch nos. 023b21 and 016b21a) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No medical history was provided by the reporter. Concomitant products included ETHINYLESTRADIOL, NORETHISTERONE ACETATE (JUNEL) and ISOTRETINOIN for an unknown indication. On 07-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) 1 dosage form. On 05-May-2021, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On 05-May-2021, the patient experienced FOOD INTOLERANCE (Can't keep food down), RETCHING (Dry heaving), DYSPHAGIA (She can't drink a lot of liquids), PAIN IN EXTREMITY (right arm soreness), VOMITING (Vomiting a little), NAUSEA (very nauseous/nausea) and HEADACHE (Headache). On 06-May-2021, the patient experienced SYNCOPE (fainted) (seriousness criterion medically significant), BEDRIDDEN (Can't do a lot,has been staying in bed), PAIN (Aches and pains), DIZZINESS (Dizzy) and PYREXIA (Fever of 102.5 degrees). On 05-May-2021, PAIN IN EXTREMITY (right arm soreness) had resolved. On 06-May-2021, SYNCOPE (fainted) and DIZZINESS (Dizzy) had resolved. On 07-May-2021, PYREXIA (Fever of 102.5 degrees) had resolved. At the time of the report, FOOD INTOLERANCE (Can't keep food down), BEDRIDDEN (Can't do a lot,has been staying in bed), RETCHING (Dry heaving), DYSPHAGIA (She can't drink a lot of liquids), PAIN (Aches and pains), VOMITING (Vomiting a little), NAUSEA (very nauseous/nausea) and HEADACHE (Headache) outcome was unknown. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 06-May-2021, Body temperature: 102.5 (High) 102.5 degree F. No treatment medication were received. Company Comment : Based on current available information and the temporal association between product use and the start date of the events a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on current available information and the temporal association between product use and the start date of the events a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

Updated: May 31, 2021
